reviews.text: For my 500th review this year *2019)...I have to give it to this oldie that I&#39;ve just re-discovered!<br><br>I remember when I was in my 20&#39;s and had a friend that waited tables at this location. We use to come by all the time to get free food but then I think we grew out of it. But coming back here after being away for so long...all I can say is...where have I been!<br><br>I recently came out with a friend who got a gift card for Christmas. The story is that I was complaining that you can&#39;t get good Shepherd&#39;s pie in Georgia. I have no idea why I have an affinity for British foods but I do. The craving is especially evident after I watch some kind of show or movie with British accents. Well my friend somehow among her other random knowledge of &#34;stuff&#34; that is either completely useless and or deemed nearly completely useless said <br><br>&#34;hey the cheesecake factory has awesome shepherd&#39;s pie!&#34; <br><br>Me: How...what....how do you even know this? I mean it&#39;s not like Shepherd&#39;s pie is brought up in everyday conversations like... hey you know where I can get a good cup of coffee...or a slice of good pizza or donuts....<br><br>My friend Aimee: dunno, too much Doctor Who episodes I suppose...<br><br>Well she was right. The Cheesecake Factory does known how to rock a Shepherd&#39;s pie. The sauce was flavorful and not overly salty. The portions was generous. Our waiter was super sweet and attentive. Had a great time here! Thank you guys for a great experience....will be back very soon! Cheers!

It&#39;s always good to go here especially during National cheesecake day! Friendly staff &amp; go to at the bar for better seating. The food is Always good &amp; we&#39;ll be back for the happy hour!!

Don&#39;t waste your time coming on the weekend.I Had a reservation at 8:45 and arrived a little early. The greeter said I had to wait and additional 10 minutes to be seated then I waited the additional 10 minutes and was  told that the restaurant was behind. After that he told me to come exactly at 8:45. Around 9:20 I was finally seated. The waiter was very rude and seemed like he didn&#39;t give af about me. He even gave me the wrong drinks. Upon doing that he made sure my appetizers were cold. I had to wait 40 minutes to receive those.I then began placing my main course  and had to wait and additional hour.He took it upon himself to give me very small portions of the cheesecake since I seemed like I was an inconvenience.This was beyond horrible service PLEASE DONT COME HERE you will waste time and money. Just FYI the server name was JESSE P he&#39;s so rude, seemed very racist and acted like it was my fault to come eat dinner here. Received Horrible service here came on 10-2-202( a Friday night). Honestly you would be better going to the location in BUFORD it&#39;s more professional there and very organized.

Dinner after work. No wait to be seated. Wonderful!   Jordan waited on us and she was awesome. Super friendly. Made great suggestions. Spoke knowledgeably about items on the menu we had questions about and she was quick and efficient!!  Our drinks came quickly and we went with appetizers for dinner. I had the dynamite shrimp and pork belly sliders. My companion had fried chicken sliders and loaded potato balls. Portions are generous and everything tasty. We couldn&#39;t finish it all so I had to get dessert to go as my favorite cheesecake is back on the menu. Pineapple upside down for the win!!  Nice evening!!

You know when you order your food all excited to eat and then... it comes terrible. It&#39;s sad I had to experience this when I love the cheesecake factory, but threw my money away literally. Ordered a WELL done hamburger and got it ALIVE...

Dined here last Friday and the waiter was very attentive and quick to satisfy our orders. I had the chipotle chicken pasta and was very full! Even had enough for leftovers the next day. I&#39;ll come back to this location for sure!

My husband and I had a wonderful time at Cheesecake Factory-Perimeter Location. For appetizer, we had the fried macaroni and cheese balls with marina sauce. For entrees,I had the parmesan crusted chicken with mashed potatoes and green beans and my husband had the truffle honey fried chicken with mashed potatoes and asparagus. For dessert, we had the Celebration cheesecake. You will NOT be disappointed by any of these choices. EVERYTHING was DELICIOUS!! Our waiter, Joe, was great! He checked in on us enough that it wasn&#39;t overbearing nor neglectful. His service was top notch! Oh for drinks I recommend the JW&#39;s Pink Lemonade and the Mai Tai.

The worst Cheesecake Factory, and my last experience here has deterred me from the chain entirely. The cheesecakes are delicious without a doubt, but it&#39;s not worth the ridiculous prices, extremely long waits (to be seated and for your food), and terrible customer service. <br><br>Long story short, I ordered my fiancé a cheesecake for his birthday last year, and honestly if I wanted the cake to look like a 5 year old made it, I would have asked my niece. I ordered the cake around 9am the morning of his birthday to be ready by 4pm. I got there a little after 4pm thinking that I would give them an extra 10-15 minutes to get my order ready because it&#39;s always extremely busy there. Didn&#39;t get my order until over 40 minutes after my arrival so it was actually about an hour after the pickup time that I requested, and yet a couple of the workers had the audacity to be extra stank and cause a scene when I was quite politely inquiring about the wait time. It&#39;s just cheesecake guys. I&#39;m sure it gets very busy there, but you don&#39;t have to make transferring a slice of cheesecake onto a plate with a squirt of whipped cream that difficult and stressful--it will be okay. <br><br>Even though it was evident that something was wrong from an employee yelling and being dramatic over plating cheesecake, there wasn&#39;t a manager or supervisor in sight to try to deescalate the situation. Two employees tried to remedy the horrific experience I had, and they were very sweet and accommodating, which is pretty standard for decent customer service nowadays, but it&#39;s unfortunate that some can&#39;t even manage that.<br><br>Aside from the cheesecake, there&#39;s really nothing else worth coming here for. The food is subpar and extremely overpriced. Not worth it at all unless you like overly greasy and flavorless food with high prices. I probably would never eat here again, and it may take a while for me to actually want to order a cheesecake from them again, but next time I&#39;ll be sure not to order it for a special occasion and arrive an hour later than my pickup time.

I ordered the truffle honey chicken and Madeira/ stk dian for curb side pick up. The chicken Madeira plate was absolutely horrible. The chicken was tough, dry and burned. The mushrooms were completely burned. The mash potatoes were raw and cold. The truffle honey chicken was cold and the potato&#39;s were also cold dry and raw. This was not what I expected especially from The Cheesecake Factory. I tried calling in order to give them an opportunity to fix their wrong but there was no answer. This truly ruined a great night with my husband.

What a terrible experience my family had tonight! Our server treated us totally different from the other tables since we got there! We had to ask for drinks and bread several times, after a long hour waiting we got our COLD food! Manager didn&#39;t care about our complain. I asked for to go box and the server just simply throw the box on top of my food!! This restaurant will never see us again for sure, really disappointed!

The hostesses never seem like they have received any training.<br>Our waitress brought us plain dry bread with our appetizer like we hate life. Do you have to special request butter? <br><br>Drinks are amazing. The food is amazing. If only the staff could give a damn.

This review is based from a take out order. This was not a dine in experience. I ordered the Cheeseburger Egg Rolls. <br><br>It was a good price for an appetizer $6.95. Thats where all the good ends. This could have been so much more. I was hoping it would ve good. It was not. It lacked flavor. Maybe if it jad some finely minced onion incorporated in the seasoning or maybe even green onions but it was however very bland. Absolutely no taste. These should either be revised or removed from the menu. The cheese and meat inside was kind of congealed. I expected them to be hot and more or less oozing from the cheese factor. It was neither. The eggroll portion was really overdone and I tatsed no spices. It was like it was just hamburger and cheese. Its a no go for me.

If host had a personal rating the host from this night would fail LARGELY. <br><br>Me and my family went for my brothers 18th birthday. Horrible experience. We made a reservation for 7:00pm on October 12th 2020. The host was the start to the horrible service we received. He was a male along with another host who was a male with a pony tail in head. Names ANDRE and MJ They were horrible and had attitudes. When we put in for our reservation (early) we were told we had to wait until 7. We did. Prior we asked for outside seating. When 6:50 arrived we asked about the outside seating to find out the host with the ponytail never even put our &#34;check-in&#34; in the system. So our &#34;check up&#34; was like asking for a table all over again.... but a last we have reservations..... can you believe and to our surprise our reservations meant nothing we were told we would have to wait an hour for outside seating after already waiting two hours. At this time it is 7:00 and now we are expecting to take our seat per reservations the two host never acknowledged us never started to seat us. And then..... a family of 9, in particular a white family (my family is black) came in with reservations and were seated immediately with no problems. This was horrible experience the two host who worked this day do not deserve to work in the food industry. Their attitudes towards my family left the taste of disappointment and frustration in my mouth and almost ruined the day of my brothers 18th birthday dinner. THESE TWO MEN NEED TO BE HELD ACCOUNTABLE IMMEDIATELY. Manager was able to find seating in a timely manner and she helped as much as she could but the damage was already done at the start of the evening. Needs to be more proper trained and more filled with some life host. They were Walking around with attitudes and upsetting a young person and their family on his birthday, this needs disciplinary actions to it! Thank God there are other cheesecake factorys in Atl. Because i will NEVER visit the Ashford-Dunwoody location EVER again. HORRIBLE ACT AS HUMANS

It was a great experience! Our server Katrina was excellent! Their COVID-19 protocol is still one of the best out there. We went out to celebrate my mother&#39;s 79th birthday. I requested to be isolated from others due to the COVID-19 concerns and the manager&#39;s were understanding and accommodating with my request. My family and I were very appreciative and thankful!!

My brother treated my mom and I on 9/20 for an early birthday celebration.  Our birthdays are on the 24th and 26th.  My mom been having issues being in public for the past 3-4 years, so it was already hard, but a relief that she came.  We understood the wait, so that was no issue with what&#39;s going on.  I just want to thank the staff for treating my mom like a queen.  One of the managers came and had a conversation with her, in which she haven&#39;t really talked to people outside of family like that.  When she got home, she was still excited that she talked to her.  That&#39;s what made my birthday this year special!  Thank you, again!
We have been to this location many times and the staff and food are always amazing! They are keeping both the staff and customers safe. This is a go to spot for us
Worst experience and the management was not very helpful after I complained. I won&#39;t go into detail but I am absolutely never coming back !

Today i made a reservation at 2:30 for a party of 6. It was 3:45 when we got seated and i seen parties of 6 and even 13 people got seated before us. My friend had to leave for her flight while we were waiting. Which really upsets me. I wonder if i came in  and got a table i would get seated faster. What is the point of a reservation? The lady in the red was rude (maybe manger, seems like she was bossing the employees) and pretended to ignore us when we asked how longer will we be waiting. We had to keep asking and they kept telling us they are wiping a table down for us. I was so unhappy. Our server was nice and sang happy birthday to me. Our food came right out.  So 2 stars for that! I wont be returning to Cheesecake Factory. They lost a dedicated customer.

Y&#39;all I can&#39;t express to you how much I LOOOOOVE the Cheesecake Factory. They literally have one of the best &#34;happy hours&#34; I&#39;ve ever been to. They have a lot of food options on their menu. The staff was friendly and very attentive. Every Cheesecake Factory i have been too has been very clean which is a plus for me. Soo if you are around one def check out their happy hour which is M-F from 4-6pm be there or be square
Had the gumbo delivered to me and it was not good. It was also cold. I&#39;ll stick to the honey truffle chicken.

We walked right in and was greeted right away. We opted for bar seating and the bartenders greeted us immediately. We placed our drink orders and a second bartender came up and took our orders. We order small plates and drinks i ordered the Tex mex egg rolls and my beau the fried macaroni and cheese. The drinks we really good and so was the food. This location is my fav. The staff, food and drinks were excellent!!! On a busy day the wait can be long but for this late night snack it was perfect!

Came here countless times and its becoming one of my favorite American restaurants. There is usually a wait of about 15 minutes before getting a table because the place is always packed. I usually take this time to oogle and drool over the display of cheesecakes. Most the time, thats still not enough time for me to fully decide which cheesecake i will have later for dessert. I love the free bread and butter they serve too as you wait for your meal. The bread is always baked fresh and warm! My favorite menu items would probably be the thai lettuce wraps or the miso salmon. While the lettuce wraps are technically under the appetizers, they give such large portions that it can definitely be a meal! Their salmon is always soft and moist and they give plenty of their amazing sauce!

My Girlfriend and I came in and was greeted with great service. Food and drinks was served right on time. The time spent there was nice and chill. Our server keshia has excellent customer service skills and came to our needs on time.

So after a rough end to our pool party we decided to go find food. We landed at the Cheesecake Factory. Believe it or not I&#39;ve been here many times and have yet to have a piece of cheesecake! Crazy I know. <br><br>The location is perfect. If you are familiar with the perimeter area it&#39;s right there in the center of all. Right in the mall. <br><br>The food was actually really good I had the cauliflower And a piece of cheesecake. My cousin had some kind of chicken pasta with cappers looked really yummy.  <br><br>We took them home because we didn&#39;t get to finish. Was good. The 4 stars is simply because of the waiter. Will go to Another location if need be but will definitely get another piece of cheesecake.

This location was very nice, clean and it represented the brand extremely well. Our waiter was super friendly and accommodating. The food came out fast and was delicious. I had a side caesar, the cashew chicken entree and a virgin strawberry daiquiri.  Yum. Yum. And more yum.<br><br>Whenever I&#39;m back, I&#39;ll definitely return.

Ok, my first time to cheesecake factory.  My daughter said I would like it, so I looked up the website and saw happy hour 4pm to 6pm.<br>We went go seated, and ordered drinks. waiter was nice, and the drinks were good.  Then I received my bill, all the drinks were full price.<br>I asked the waiter isn&#39;t it happy hour 4pm to 6pm, he said happy hour is only at the bar. I said the website did not state that, where does it say that. He said the sign at the front door (mind you I walked in, all I saw was a sign for covid-19 safety.) Waiter stepped away, I saw a manager I asked her the same (she repeated the same, the sign is up front. I said the website does not say that-she said sorry)  <br>I went ahead and paid my bill and left about 15% for the waiter.<br>I walked up front to see the sign, no sign.  I asked this lovely young lady the same questions where does it say happy hour is at the bar.  She went to the sign, flipped it so it could be visible to me and others.<br>Left the restaurant went to get my car, but the principle of the matter was bothering me. (FALSE ADVERTISEMENT) I went back to ask for a manager&#39;s card, the happy hour sign was now flipped over after 6pm (happy hour was over)<br><br>My point is this...<br>Luckily I could afford the bill, thank goodness it was not someone else who thought it was happy hour, Like I did. (receive the bill and all drinks are full price)<br><br>I live in the neighborhood, fool me once (Not again).<br>I will go to the other real happy hour around the perimeter.<br>(CUSTOMER SERVICE/HAPPY HOUR CLEARLY STATED)<br><br>I guess in these weird times people/companies need money, but man....<br>Where&#39;s the customer service.....

Everytime I go to the Cheesecake Factory I get avocado egg rolls, they never disappoint. The service at this location was good, as was the ambience. The waitress was kind. I&#39;d visit this location again.

For Mother&#39;s Day I brought my mom and granny to this location (their chose out of all the restaurants in Atlanta). Since it was their day, I treated without complaint. We arrived around afternoon. As expected, it was packed! We were told our wait (for 3) was about 45 minutes. We walked around Perimeter Mall for a bit. When we came back to the restaurant the hostess told us it would be another 10 minutes before a table was available. Ten minutes turned into 30 minutes. We actually waited a total of an 1hr and 15 minutes for a table of 3. I was close to leaving but didn&#39;t see the point seeing as how we&#39;d probably have to wait that long at another restaurant. <br><br>Once seated things seemed much better. Our very cute waiter, Jay (or DJ?) brought us our menus, bread and drinks quickly. He was a great waiter and did fantastic serving not only our table but those around us. Our appetizer, Fried Macaroni and Cheese was not great. Whatever cheese is being used needs to be changed. It was very bland and boring. My drink, Pineapple Ginger Martini tasted really good! My entree was the Chicken and Shrimp gumbo. It was well seasoned and probably my favorite dish now!

Was nearby for a work training and hadn&#39;t been to one in years so decided to stop by and sit in the bar area for lunch! It did not disappoint! It always takes a while to make a decision due to all of the options on their menu! I ordered the tomato basil penne and it was delicious! It was a pretty big portion so I was able to take home half of them for leftovers. The bartender was friendly and did a good job ad being attentive to everyone as the bar was pretty crowded. The menu definitely has options for any and every one so I would definitely recommend everyone checking it out. The service was great and my food came out quickly which was very much appreciated due to my short lunch away from work!

My kids and I came here thinking breakfast we end up having lunch. Cheesecake factory never disappoint the food is always good no matter what you choose and what route you decide to go. We got seated right away great customer service and our waiter was excellent and we got our food fast. Everything tasted good. We were here very early so parking was not a problem.

It was my niece&#39;s birthday and her quesadilla came out soaky and my macaroni and cheese burger was burnt. Manager came out with nothing but excuses and no apologies. They even tried to use the fact that dekalb county had a water advisory as an excuse. The servicers never checked on us for refills or anything and when I did ask for something (a cup of ice) it took them 10 minutes and only after I asked again. They forgot my brother-in-law fries, forgot who ordered what, and all and all no stars and won&#39;t be back.

This place is way too pricy, but dang I love the food.... <br><br>Their menu is practically a novel, but almost everything I&#39;ve tried is good. The Fish &amp; chips, antioxidant kale salad, and the burgers are great. The only thing I really DON&#39;T recommend is the calamari. It was disgusting.<br><br>Their cheesecake, of course, is fantastic. I always come with boyfriend and we get the red velvet one!

This is a great restaurant. I&#39;ve never been to a bad Cheesecake Factory, and this location is no exception. I love that they put a little sugar ring on the lemonade. The crab bites are also really good.

Well, another bad choice while in Atlanta this weekend. Apps were good, unfortunately my Thanksgiving Turkey sandwich was very underwhelming, it was all bread with very little turkey, stuffing and cranberry that was promised on the menu. What deli Turkey was there was dry and tasteless. Come on, don&#39;t mess with Thanksgiving Turkey, if you can&#39;t do it right take it off the 10 page menu. Also, my meal came 5 minutes prior to everyone else in my party. <br>. On a positive note when our sweet waiter realized I don&#39;t eat my meal, he took it off the bill and asked if I wanted anything else. 5 stars for service.
The wait time for the food were ridiculous. The server(Katie A)were great. She came by to let us know what we&#39;re going on with everything &amp; have long the food were going to be .

Seriously it&#39;s always good here..It&#39;s the Cheesecake Factory! I&#39;ve never been disappointed in anything I&#39;ve ordered and it&#39;s a nicer chain to grab lunch or a drink. I love the lettuce wraps and the giant salads they have. The bread is probably my favorite thing (lol) and the service is always friendly
Want to The Cheesecake Factory at Perimeter Mall order the impossible burger with a salad along with my salad came a cockroach

Please don&#39;t contact these people over the phone, or expect any type of good service from them it&#39;s pretty much a classic situation of the left hand doesn&#39;t know what the right hand is doing, saving everyone the trouble.

Picture says most of what I need to say . <br>Chicken is way too big , half of my chicken was falling apart. They skimp you on the chicken when you order to go ! Compare this to the picture they have listed online :)
Thanks Cheese Cake Factory for our great lunch today. The portions were huge and everything was delicious. The pickup process was very easy.

We have been to many Cheesecake Factory, from Cumberland Mall to Hawaii in Waikiki to Pleasanton And San Jose California, this is by far the worst Cheesecake Factory we have ever been to. <br><br>Food is great it was the service with Tara, not giving all the detail but for sure not coming to this location again.

The wait for our party of 12 was almost two hours, even though we called ahead. To make matters worse, they gave our party to a single server. She was very nice, but they should&#39;ve assigned two. At the end of the meal, when it was time to order dessert, they were out of the ONE cheesecake I wanted. The level of customer service here isn&#39;t what it used to be. I was highly disappointed.

A coworker friend and I visited another local Perimeter hot happy hour spot a week prior-but opted for a less expensive/pretentious environment this time.  To our surprise THIS was sitting under our nose the whole time!<br><br>Happy Hour here offers bigger portions &amp; healthier libations....at a more reasonable price.  The crab artichoke dip &amp; the black bean chicken mini burrito wrap were both enough to share for a party of 4.  We were only too happy to eat it all-in 2. <br><br>Needless to say, we will return to shake the weekday chills.

I&#39;m being generous with this 4 because there is no 3.5 on the scale.<br><br>They are extremely overwhelmed at this location. I went twice during my stay near Perimeter Mall and was placed in the same section in the back, where it&#39;s hard to find a server, and when you do- the kitchen is backed up. <br><br>Cheesecake Factory has removed the best items from their menu, like firecracker salmon, so there&#39;s really no reason for me to visit as many times as I once did.<br><br>I tried to help the food traffic both times by ordering fast meals like eggs or broccoli and they still came late and cold.<br><br>This is a separation for me... until further notice

I have been a fan of Cheesecake Factory for years. I have created many memories at various CFs. And the food and atmosphere is still bangin.<br><br>If you are looking for a place with an extensive menu and a plethora of cheesecakes then this is the place to go.<br><br>Now about the Perimeter Mall location...whoever the young lady was working take-out two weeks ago, she had a very sour attitude and lied to me about them discontinuing a menu item after we had a disagreement on the name of the item. I was trying to order cauliflower wings and she stated that they did not sell those. After a few seconds of back and forth and having her get a menu for me, she informed me that they are called Korean fried cauliflower and that that menu item has been discontinued. Therefore, that day I left only with a slice of pumpkin cheesecake.<br>Well then, why to my surprise did I go back to CF this past weekend and I was magically able to order the Korean fried cauliflower? Smh, not a way to build customer rapport.<br><br>Also, I don&#39;t know when or why restaurants started doing this, but there were three people in my party and each person got their food at a different time, the last person getting his 20-25 minutes after the second person. Everyone was done or very close to finished eating by the time the last person was served. Awful timing, thus creating a not so nice experience.

Overall a pleasant experience at The Cheesecake Factory.  This restaurant is located at Perimeter Mall, near Ashford Dunwoody Road NE.<br><br>We went on a Sunday night, around 8:15 PM and were seated relatively quickly.  Our waitress was extremely helpful and polite and provided refreshments and bread with butter immediately.<br><br>We placed our orders and received our food within 30 minutes, was a little surprised by the length of time it took due to the relative quietness of the restaurant.<br><br>Overall a typical Cheesecake Factory outing, nothing surprising, well definitely stop by here again.

I hate to leave this review but this was the absolute worst experience we have ever had at a Cheesecake Factory. The first host in the doorway was so incredibly rude we ended up leaving before we were even sat. I originally walked past that stand to the normal hostess stand and were rudely turned away and sent to the first hostess stand. When I went back to check in I explained to the young girl that no one was here a few moments ago and we are kinda confused on the new process. She rudely stated &#34; yea I was talking &#34; in response to not being at her post. She continued to be extremely rude so we decided it was best to spend our money elsewhere. The food here is amazing and the wait staff has always been great but when your front of the house is so dysfunctional you lose business.
The food was ok. Just know if you want really quick service do not sit at the bar. Bartender was very nice but he was more into serving drinks orders to employees.

Unfortunately, I wasn&#39;t very happy with my order today. I&#39;m not sure if it&#39;s just a lack of consistency between locations. This was my first time ordering from the Dunwoody location as I usually go to the Lenox mall location. Every time I order, I get Sheila&#39;s chicken salad and really only because of the peanut dressing. The salad I received today was a strange mix of greens, there were no carrots and the shrimp wasn&#39;t grilled at all. The worst of it was that it was a totally different dressing!!! If I hadn&#39;t driven so long to get home, I would have taken it back. <br><br>The filet mignon wasn&#39;t cooked well done as I&#39;d requested, but I did enjoy it. The service was also good and I loved that there was parking right outside for those picking up to-go orders.

So I am really disappointed in the food at this location. This is a chain restaurant and consistency is key. Well this location at Perimeter Mall lacks consistency. In my opinion, they have some great cooks and then some not so great. This review pertains to a take out order that I just received. I ordered off the brunch menu and I got a Belgian Waffle and a side of bacon. I was given a time of 20 minutes and I received my food 45 minutes later. I don&#39;t mind waiting because I understand how restaurants operate. When I got my food, it was not hot at all. I asked for utensils and napkins and I didn&#39;t receive that nor did I receive butter or syrup. My thought process goes to how will I consume your cold food. I have given this location two times to get it right and they HAVE NOT!!! So I will have to go LENOX location. Here&#39;s my suggestion...better leadership and training needs to be done quick, fast and a hurry for all shifts. I will go back to what I said in the beginning. Consistency is key and it is the success of any business! I hope you all get it together for others that will patron your location in the future. I will NOT BE RETURNING......PERIOD!!!!

Besides mask requirements to eat in a restaurant dinner was good. I guess you can get Covid walking in and out of restaurant but cannot get it  once you sit down to eat. Food was good and Lane was a great server!

I really enjoyed my visit to the Cheesecake Factory. There is so much diversity on the menu I had a hard time choosing exactly what I wanted to eat, but I was very satisfied when I did finally make a decision. I ordered the Jamaican Black Pepper Shrimp and it was soooooo good! There was no wait time when we arrived and the food came out fairly quick. The flavor was on point. Everything was fresh and hot and our waiter did a wonderful job on checking on us throughout our visit. Of course you can&#39;t visit The Cheesecake Factory without finishing your meal with a slice of decadent cheesecake. I ordered the lemon meringue cheesecake and it was also sooooooo good! Overall i had a 5 star experience during my visit. I forgot to get pictures of the cheesecake but take a second to admire that beautiful plate of flavor!
Always delicious!  Cheesecake first, then I decide what I want for lunch!  Ate at the bar and they social distanced well.

Hey I can tell you why this place has such terrible reviews and it&#39;s coming from a guy who&#39;s currently employed there. Man behind the scenes this restaurant is filthy and the workers are trifling! If one was too peek around the corner where door dash pick up food, you&#39;ll see Cheesecake Factory servers and cooks, too busy committing simulated sex acts on one another. Sometimes it&#39;s girl on girl action but most of the time it&#39;s guy on guy action. After touch each other&#39;s breasts and genitals you&#39;ll see them playing with the customers food! I really don&#39;t know why my fellow black people like to be have that way but hey that&#39;s how life goes. Even when it slow and after the food is done, the servers will be too busy foundling each other private parts or having boss talk about some miscellaneous bull shit. I hate the fact management allows this to go on then again some industries allow such things too take place as part of there work place culture. Not only have I witnessed servers eating off customers plates, I&#39;ve also saw these guys use either dirty dishes or eating utensils that WASN&#39;T PROPERLY WASHED for the guests to use. Hey I think it&#39;s a good idea for Dekalb County health department to pay this place a visit after 6pm only and more than likely they&#39;ll find plenty to write them up about. <br>It&#39;s sad when you see management joining in on the hanky panky that&#39;s causing tremendous wait time for customers orders. And also if you get the wrong order it&#39;s because somebody ate your stuff and more than likely they&#39;re just bringing you out anything to get you to calm down. <br>By the way even though there dishwashing team looks like crack heads least they have more sense to not do the things the servers do.
As always, the BEST cheesecake EVER. I picked up three pieces, (1 piece of Oreo Extreme and 2 pieces of Red Velvet) for Father&#39;s Day for the special men&#39;s in my life.

Cheesecake Factory can do no wrong in my eyes. They are such a long standing classic, romantic yet family oriented restaurant. Best cheesecakes you an buy from a restaurant. I usually order either the Lemon Herb Roasted Chicken or the Jamaican Black Pepper Shrimp. Both are just amazing. The lemon herb chicken is packed with flavors. You can definitely taste the lemon and it goes perfectly with the herbs. It&#39;s paired with carrots that are cooked just right. Not overdone and not too hard. The Jamaican shrimp is also packed with flavor which is a must. It&#39;s paired with rice and black beans and a diced pineapples melody. It&#39;s delicious. This location is relatively close to my job so I usually order Togo. They are pretty busy at this location so I would recommend to dine in if you have the chance. Don&#39;t forget to ask the staff for a slick of cake, you won&#39;t regret it.

I still love you, Cheesecake Factory. Especially your bar. Even though you share your good cooking with everyone since you&#39;re a chain. I still love you! I guess that makes me the side chick :(     #dontjudgeme<br><br>They make an AWESOME Strawberry Martini. And if you&#39;re a fan of blueberry and a fan of martinis (girly ones, not grown man ones with the olives), order a Cosmo with Stoli Blueberry. You can thank me later. <br><br>My favorite dishes (that are still on the menu) - Chicken Picatta, Hamburgers (Yes, I know it&#39;s the CF, but their burgers are AWESOME), Chicken Littles, Avocado Eggrolls, Buffalo Blasts, Shrimp Scampi, Herb Crusted and Grilled Salmon, Southern Fried Catfish, and a few of the combination platters. Please make sure you&#39;re ready to work this food off, because the portions are huge and the calorie counts are NOT low, for the most part. Budget your calories for this place, especially if you plan on having cheesecake (which is also amazing). The menu is extensive, so if you&#39;ve got indecisive or picky eaters, this is usually a good &#34;compromise&#34; spot. They&#39;ll even customize your food for you (within reason).<br><br>Amazing food, amazing drinks, usually amazing service (It ranges from good to amazing, but I&#39;ve never been to a CF and had BAD, let me complain to the manager service) - I still love this place. <br><br>The minus a star isn&#39;t for this location specifically - it&#39;s for all. They&#39;ve recently changed their menu and took away some of my favorite dishes, like the garlic noodles. WHHHHHYYYYY??? DAMMMMN DAMMMMN DAMMMMN (*Florida Evans Voice*)!

I placed two online orders for curbside pickup. One on the weekend of Father&#39;s Day and another one on July 11th. The one I placed on Father&#39;s Day, I never received after waiting in my hot car for over 2 hours. I had a family member place the order again and finally 45 minutes after the 2nd order was placed, I received it. The order on July 11th was for 1 shrimp scampi and 1 lemon garlic shrimp pasta. They placed lemon garlic sauce on both dishes. The white wine sauce is the seller for the shrimp scampi. The pasta for the shrimp scampi was gooey and clumped together. The food at Cheesecake is too expensive to be served any less than perfect. I&#39;m done with this location and I&#39;m hoping other locations are better than this one.

I actually like this restaurant chain a lot, but tonight&#39;s experience left much to be desired. Especially since this was my birthday dinner (chosen because kid friendly). When I came in to look for my party already here, the hostess gave me directions to my table instead of showing me. Not that big of a deal. We ordered appetizers that came out at different times and served after the kid&#39;s meals. <br><br>The avocado eggrolls are usually a hit, but cilantro taste was overpowering tonight. With the calamari, the breading just kept falling off, and it seemed too greasy. I ordered the Diane Steak and Chicken Madeira combination with spinach. The steak was almost well done although I ordered medium. I think it had too much pepper to the point where it tasted sort of spicy. The Turkey burger was good, as usual. The best thing might have been the kids chicken tenders, and of, the cheesecake. I tried the cheesecake with white chocolate and macadamia nuts and it was okay. May stick with original next time.<br><br>Overall, I do love their variety on the menu, the brunch, and drink variety. The ambience is nice for couples, larger parties, and even kids. Service is usually okay, nothing special, but you&#39;ll get your needs met. And of course, great variety of desserts (not so much if you dont like cheesecake). I&#39;m disappointed in tonight, but will still be back at some point.

Someone has been keeping this under wraps but I got the scoop! I had no idea they did Sunday brunch. Apparently many of my Atlantans have been keeping this secret. Well NO MORE!<br><br>I had the best French toast brioche I&#39;ve ever had in my life! It was soft fluffy flavorful and most of all yummy! Lol. The texture is unlike anything I&#39;ve ever had. I can&#39;t really describe it. You&#39;ve got to experience it for yourself.<br><br>It was so good I had to ask for the manager. April, the manager, was as sweet as can be. She detailed how the brioche actually soaks overnight for this extravagant tasty outcome. Wow. <br><br>I am amazed yet again. Thank you Cheesecake Factory. You made my weekend brighter!!!

Just left what I believe to be the most unorganized, unprofessional, Cheesecake Factory located at Perimeter Mall in ATL. The wait for a table was expected, and not an issue. I was looking forward to having a memorable New Years Eve dinner with  family. What we did not expect was to find a plastic cup cover in a water mug instead  of ice. We were surprised, but what was more surprising was the attitude of the server and manager. The server simply replaced the water without a word when it was brought to her attention. The manager removed the mug from our table without a word when we brought it to his attention. <br><br>We ordered an appetizer- they were sold out of it! The other appetizer came after about 25 minutes.  When we ordered our entree-again they were out of one of our choices. So I selected another entree. Our sever was busy with a large table. By this time another server brought us our food and more bread, rather than our server. Multiple plates from the appetizers were left on the table as we ate our entrees, no effort was made to remove them.<br><br>The combination of the plastic top in the water mug,  and lack of response from management was disappointing. We did bring it to managers attention as we left, he did adjust final bill, but it didn&#39;t make up for the overall experience.  I will not be back.

Let me start by saying...<br>I LOVE THE CHEESECAKE FACTORY!!   <br>For the money, they have the best menu and everything I have ever eaten here is absolutely delicious. <br>That said. I have been to this location twice in the last 6 months and both times we were disappointed with the service. When we came in the winter of 2019 the food was good but the service was poor. I excused it as a one time thing. Just an off night for somebody, but not last night.  <br>We were seated quickly and we were off to a good start for a Birthday dinner for one of our party.  But it didn&#39;t last long. The waiter arrived and took drink orders. Returned promptly with drinks and took the appetizer order. All good so far and then....<br>When he returned for our dinner order he had no pen or pad. He listened as we all gave our order, then verified a few details and he was off.  I have never liked this approach. I&#39;m not impressed if you manage to do your job and get the order right but it is frustrating as all when you can&#39;t remember and get it wrong. Make the effort to get it right and that means writing it down!!!  <br>This guy retuned a few minutes later and said &#34; that Filet was medium well right?   Uh NO. Medium rare please !<br>Well it was all downhill from there.  One meal came out correct. The one with no sides. The second meal came out with the wrong sides. The third meal was something no one had ordered and the fourth meal was a no show. The two people who had food were obliged to go ahead and eat while the other two waited. About 21minutes later as the first two were finished the third meal arrived.  A Perfectly cooked Filet with the wrong sides.  I reminded the waiter I had ordered a Caesar salad about 45 minutes ago and it would be nice to eat while I was waiting on my food. <br>My salad arrived shortly after and it was ok. No sign of my entree anywhere. When he finally came back to tell me it should be out shortly I went ahead and canceled it. Everyone else had already finished, two for almost 30 minutes.  He had a manager remove the entree from the bill and we ordered cheesecake on the online app so we could get away from this guy.  It was the worst example of  a poor waiter showing his inabilities.  Btw. The manager who fixed the bill never bothered to show up at the table.  And that&#39;s why this location is the worst of all the Cheesecake Factories I have ever dined at.  Stay away from this location or you might be sorry!!!

Its my bestie&#39;s favorite so its not so uncommon that we&#39;ll end up here if we can&#39;t decide where to eat.  <br><br>Cheesecake is a chain and it differs from location to location but we prefer this one over Buckhead due to convenience being a central location and that they still carry chicken luau salad that Buckhead doesn&#39;t.<br><br>Though Cheesecake can be a headache with long waits and too many options, its always the perfect option to cater to all cravings.  Yesterday, I finally satisfied my craving of a burger with the skinnylicious burger.  Though I didn&#39;t really eat skinnylicious when I ate a good portion of my fiance&#39;s Louisiana chicken salad on top of their bread lol.<br><br>That brings me to their awesome Hawaiian and sour dough bread! Try to tame yourself though, you get all your carbs before the actual meal, which we usually do.  <br><br>Typically we come to cheesecake without getting cheesecake due to the HUGE portion sizes here but great for sharing.  Some of our favorite plates are: <br> <br>-Luau chicken salad that comes with crispy wonton flakes that you break up with tangy and sweet dressing<br>-Louisiana chicken pasta - flash fried chicken cutlets with peppery and creamy bowtie pasta<br>-Pasta carbonara that&#39;s creamy and bacony with a spoonful of green peas (That counts as veggies!) This is one of my favs but totally made out of carbs, hence the name.<br>-Cajun jambalaya pasta - Bountiful of chicken and shrimp with fresh tomatoes on top.  Pretty tasty!<br>-Chicken lettuce wraps - Awesome taco alternatives by substituting the tortilla.  Flavored with Asian sweet sauce.<br>And the list is endless...<br><br>But on top of it all, they have skinnylicious cocktails so you don&#39;t have to skimp out on Friday night celebration or any celebration.<br><br>IF you have room for cheesecake, I would highly recommend the banana pudding cheesecake.  Even for those who doesn&#39;t like cheesecake will like this with fresh bananas and cheesecake so airy and fluffy with light, refreshing banana flavor.<br><br>Cheesecake offers all and will leave you full everytime! Its just the day after your scale will snap you into reality hehe.

The cake nightmare!!! I am DONE with Cheesecake Factory. We ordered a Oreo cheesecake for a colleague&#39;s birthday with her name written on top. You have to pay extra for the name to be written on a special card to place on the cake. <br><br>Upon picking up the cake from CF, the girl proceeded to tell us that they do not have anymore cards, and the name was not written on the cake for that reason. She was not apologetic by any means. She actually looked annoyed. How could you be annoyed? You&#39;re not the one that has to give a birthday cake to someone without their name on it. Personalizing a birthday cake is how people feel special on their birthday. This is a very important part, not to mention the fact that we are spending OVER $50 for this cake! Why didn&#39;t anyone call us!? Why is the girl behind the counter having an attitude? <br><br>Finally the manager comes over, his name was Patrick. He was very nice and at least tried. He wrote the name on the cake. It was not the prettiest but he tried. I gave one star bc he tried. In the future, do not have an attitude with the customer, it isn&#39;t their fault that your inventory is not correct and we were not notified. Also if you&#39;re going to work in the bakery, and have an attitude, maybe you should work in the back. Bake the cookies, rather eat a cookie and have a smile! She needs a new job. She is lucky she didn&#39;t have her name tag on! Patrick thanks for trying... but after $50 that is ridiculous! To others just go to Publix and buy a cake. At least they will not give you an attitude.
Can&#39;t go wrong with cheesecake factory. Their cheesecake are my alltime fav. Love their menu and environment.

NOTHING whatsoever like the Lenox location, and my assumption is that the management at this location is not as involved. An appetizer of Korean Cauliflower took 20 minutes (at Lenox, we would have had it eaten and our entrees on the table in the same amount of time) and when it finally arrived, the pieces were half the size they are at Lenox and swimming in oil from the fryer. We are now waiting for our entrees... The server has passed by our table once to refill my iced tea with hot tea, effectively rendering it NOT iced tea....

Me and my girlfriend visited the perimeter mall location for my birthday on Friday and it was the worst experience I have ever had at the Cheesecake Factory. First we waited 1 hour to get our food. Then as soon as it came , it was cold and our order was wrong, then we asked to get it the way we ordered it and that took 20 more minutes. So I demanded to speak to the manager and she was polite and she fixed our order. When we got our food correctly we were very tired and we just decided to take it to go. So when we were about to leave a plate of food came flying across the floor that a waiter dropped and hit my girlfriends leg and all the food splattered on my brand new yeezys. DO NOT EAT HERE. Take your money somewhere else. The service is slow and they do not cater to you.

Do not place an order online for curbside... I waited 30 minutes in curbside parking. I ended up cancelling the order ... this was one month ago, I have not received a refund. None of the managers know how to check online orders or give refunds for them apparently. Calling in to speak to a manager ? Wait 15-20 minutes on hold. Even during daytime hours. I&#39;ve always hated the Cheesecake Factory...i tried to give them a chance. This place is a disappointment

This is your run of the mill chain restaurant but this particular location is better than most! Most CF locations are average, 3 Stars but this one, this one is a 4. Went here to catch up with friends tonight and had excellent service! The passion fruit mojito was a hit! Served in a martini glass and well made, great bartender! Bravo to you. The avocado egg rolls are good (maybe need a little extra salt). Chinese chicken salad was good too. And as always, great cheesecake, Oreo is my fav...but I got the hot fudge sundae this time, still good. they kept the fresh bread coming...carbs, ice-cream/hot fudge and alcohol...this is key to keeping girls happy :) good job Cheesecake Factory, good job. Well done.<br>FYI it&#39;s at the Perimeter mall so parking can get annoying but it&#39;s free and a huge lot. Great location. Prices are as expected for CF.

Where do I start with everything that went wrong at this location?? Ok the Asian male manager lied about the initial wait time and refused to make it right. Our server Desiree was rude and argumentative. The food was lukewarm at best. Just an overall awful experience at this location. We definitely won&#39;t be back.

I was a little conflicted on how to review this location as it does not really stand up to the other locations I&#39;ve been to. My favorite thing to order at Cheesecake Factory is the BBQ chicken salad. When I ordered it here it just didn&#39;t have that same pizzaz I&#39;ve had at other locations. The service is also very spotty and can be extremely slow at times. To be fair, the first few times we visited this location was during Cheesecake day so the restaurant was PACKED! With all that said, it does seem to be getting better from when we first came here. <br><br>Lately we&#39;ve been sticking to the bar area for happy hour and that has made the experience a bit better. Not to mention they have an awesome happy hour! I don&#39;t wanna give away too much goodness, but they have Long Island iced teas for a mere $6...and they&#39;re good!<br><br>They also have a number of small plates for around $6 each and they are great for sharing. One of my coworkers and I have almost made this a weekly tradition

I&#39;m not sure what all the negative reviews are about, but I love The Cheesecake Factory chain. This location is just as great as the others; they&#39;re pretty good about being consistent. <br><br>Details: <br>There is valet and there is self park at Perimeter Mall. This location is attached to the mall and I think you must enter from outside. <br><br>They have a bar, Togo and dining area <br><br>I never order alcoholic drinks here because they&#39;re expensive and youll need a few to get a buzz. But if you want a super expensive smoothie, be my guest. They do have happy hour but I don&#39;t remember at what time but you sit in the bar high tops and order from a happy hour menu. <br><br>Their food is kinda pricey, but it&#39;s good so I keep coming back. They have a few selections on the lunch menu but this time I ordered a burger since those are priced the same. Also, the macaroni and cheese burger was awesome! They put all the toppings like lettuce, tomato, etc on the side, and they gave me honey mustard on request. They make their own so it&#39;s really good. They also sell all their sauces up front in to go. <br><br>You should also try such items as avocado eggrolls because if you love avocados, it&#39;s pretty much a must! Also, the chicken Bellagio is a pasta dish that packs some flavor without looking like it&#39;s doing a whole lot. <br>Don&#39;t do the artichoke appetizer; it&#39;s a whole artichoke so you&#39;re going to be biting each tint edible bit off of each hard non edible bit. Too much work for the price <br><br>And the cheesecake is so worth the cost! They also have an amazing tiramisu. They also come out with a new flavor every few months and feature it on the back. <br><br>It&#39;s a small put off that the menu has ads (yes I know.. it shocked me too at first) but just ignore them and keep turning pages.

I&#39;ve eaten at cheese cake many many (one too many times) LOL. The food was standard good and I have no complaints. <br><br>However, I just had to say our server was one of the best human beings I have ever met. Cepheas H. was the most charming and friendliest server I have met in my life. He seemed to love his job and makes the whole experience of eating at cheesecake unique despite the fact that I have eaten at many different ones in different state. <br><br>He should get a raise or a promotion or at the very least free food for a year LOL. Thank you so much!

At one point in my life, I loved The Cheesecake Factory but I feel like the quality of their food has really gone down. Maybe it&#39;s just me and my evolving tastebuds but the previous times I&#39;ve left very unsatisfied. I&#39;ve tried many different dishes and they all proved to be equally disappointing. There are two things that I actually enjoy on the menu and that includes the fried mac n cheese and of course the cheesecakes but I don&#39;t think they carry enough weight to keep me coming back. <br><br>Otherwise it&#39;s a pretty decent restaurant, albeit there is usually a long wait.... and staff are always nice. This is just not a restaurant I will choose to dine at very often.

The server was courteous, the menu is all over the place, appears to center around a lot of pasta.  Not a variety of sides, they really should serve baked sweet potatoes, everyone doesn&#39;t eat mashed potatoes or white rice, rice pilaf would be an improvement.  Some better lighting would be nice, so that we who are visually impaired can read the menu.<br>Overall food was just average, not a place I would pick for myself, would probably come up with an excuse, if invited by others, I can&#39;t throw away my money.<br>Cheesecake cake is WONDERFUL!  I&#39;ll Just get it to go, when I get the urge for Cheesecake
Ewwww gross don&#39;t go there the food is spoiled gross ewww. I have no words. So I looked up there inspection and

The Cheesecake at Perimeter has consistently not done well.  I love Cheesecake but this location for whatever reason doesn&#39;t measure up! Every time I&#39;ve been here, people that I&#39;ve brought here never like it.  I came about 3 weeks ago with a friend, who orders the same dish.  He didn&#39;t even finish it, this is a dish he always cleans the plate for.  Don&#39;t know what it is about this location but I hope they do better.

Had a great night on Friday for my godsons birthday dinner. I ordered the BBQ chicken pizza and a cucumber lemonade.  Parking was easy. When I got to the restaurant, they were already seated.  They don&#39;t do reservations so before I got there the party waited an hour . The food was good.
Love the Louisiana pasta and the pina colada here.<br>Service is pretty slow thou.<br>The breads are awesome.

Back home we went to the Cheesecake Factory all the time. It was great and we saved it for special occasions. <br><br>We went to this location on my birthday and it was so disappointing. The food took forever. We never got refills on drinks or bread. My niece&#39;s fruit looked gross. The mushrooms on the mushroom burger tasted like they were soaked in teriyaki and were just so gross--and I like teriyaki. My sister&#39;s chicken had plastic melted on it and it took forever for them to fix it and it wasn&#39;t comped or discounted or anything.<br><br>We probably won&#39;t come back.

One of my favorite after work eateries! The service was great and fast ! I&#39;m an vegetarian but my aunt isn&#39;t but they have a menu that caters to both of us which is a plus . They never disappoint me .

First time at the much hyped cheesecake factory but am slightly let down by the lack of flavor and slow service. <br>Portion sizes are huge here so you get what you pay for but I&#39;d love to have more flavor in the dishes. I got the Cajun Jambalaya Pasta that was supposed to have &#34;super spicy&#34; sauce but i couldnt detect even a hint of spice. Sad.

We were here for dinner,so we sat on the porch but we were welcomed by cockroaches running around the place. That wasn&#39;t all,our waiter kept forgetting that we even existed coz we had to remind him our orders every often. But the food was great.

Do yourself a favor and don&#39;t even come to this location. <br><br>The food quality is sub par, at best, and the restaurant lacks a level of professionalism that extends beyond the servers and rests squarely on the shoulders of incompetent management.<br> I assumed by ordering one of the more expensive entrees on the menu that it might ensure a certain level of quality, but they proved me wrong.<br> <br>I started off with the spinach dip. <br>The chips were stale, and by stale, I mean they not only lacked flavor, but they had a bit more chewiness to them than any tortilla chip should have. They had the texture of chips that you buy from the store after you&#39;ve opened the bag and return a couple days later to have some. The spinach dip itself was just disappointing, I don&#39;t have any suggestions for how it could have been corrected short of &#34;just throw it out and start from scratch.&#34; I took a bite and told the waiter I was not satisfied. He told me he would leave the dish on the table so that the manager could come and talk to me about it. The manager never showed, despite seeing him walk past a few times. <br><br>My waiter eventually removed the dish himself and I ordered the steak and salmon combination dish. I requested the salmon and steak cooked medium. After a long wait, the dish arrived and I began eating to find that both items were overcooked. They should not even take a temperature request on the thin slices of meat they refer to as steak. I asked my waiter for the manager and cut into the center of both proteins ready to show that they were a far cry from medium. The manager agrees that the food is overcooked and offers to make me another one. I decline since neither my appetizer nor the entree were acceptable thus far and at this point, I wasn&#39;t going to hold out for the third time being the charm. I told him I would be happy to pay for the kid&#39;s meal and the two drinks I had ordered if he would give us a slice of cheesecake for the inconvenience. He said he wouldn&#39;t charge me for the food I didn&#39;t eat, but he also wouldn&#39;t give me the cheesecake.<br><br>I have worked in the customer service and the food service industry, and know that it&#39;s far better to give a customer an $8 slice of defrosted cheesecake to ensure a return patron than to sacrifice hundreds of dollars worth of repeat business. But this arrogant excuse for low-level management material would rather sit on his pedestal of frozen cheesecakes than to compensate for their myriad of mistakes. I asked to speak to the GM and was told she wasn&#39;t in. He refused to give me any information on how to contact her.<br><br>Beyond the lackluster food experience, from our table that was near the kitchen, we could clearly overhear the waitstaff speaking negatively about the restaurant&#39;s patrons and using profanity while doing so. Any manager worth their salt would not allow such unprofessionalism in the work place and certainly not within earshot of paying customers. <br><br>With all the bad reviews and failed health inspections on their record, this place desperately needs some sort of overhaul intervention from corporate. Unfortunately for them, I won&#39;t be around the see any improvement because they have lost my business (and the business of any friends and family that I know) for good.<br><br>Just save yourself the trouble and pick a better restaurant.

We had a great time at Cheesecake Factory. It&#39;s located at the Perimeter Mall with ample parking. The interior is very nice, certainly much nicer than I remember CF from a few years ago!<br><br>Our server was very attentive and helpful. We split the guacamole appetizer that was very good; they were accommodating in the kitchen and proper serrano separately since we had varying spice level preference. <br><br>I ordered a whiskey smash that was good, not too sweet! For my main, I ordered the veggie burger with side salad. The burger was enormous! The flavor was pretty good and the salad greens were fresh. Too full for dessert, lots of great looking options on the menu though!<br><br>I&#39;ve ordered the Jamaican black pepper shrimp in the past and it&#39;s crazy good, highly recommend.

Group of coworkers decided to go to The Cheesecake Factory for lunch on our day off. We were told the wait would be 30 min... meanwhile parties were getting sat before us, people that came after us... I asked what was going on and they stated they were cleaning the table... that took 15 min. We finally got seated and it took a long time to get our appetizers then our meals. My friend ordered a drink that she never got. The lady asked if we wanted Parmesan cheese and we said yes and she never came back. The overall service was not up to par, but the food was delicious per usual. Maybe I&#39;ll stick the one at Lenox Mall.

I had such a great experience at the Cheesecake Factory! I went with a group of friends on a Friday evening and surprisingly there was no wait. Our server was very attentive even though he was juggling two big parties. I ordered the Georgia Peach for my beverage and the pineapple chicken and shrimp as my entree. The drink was just okay- I didn&#39;t taste much alcohol. But the food was amazing! There was a combination of flavors to include garlic, onion, and pineapple- which added a nice sweetness. The chicken and shrimp were fried and tossed in the sauce as well. It also came with white rice. I would recommend this dish if you&#39;re looking for something different and light. The dish included a lot of food but was not heavy at all. Can&#39;t wait to try something else!!

I&#39;ve been eating at Cheesecake Factory ever since they opened their DC location in 1993, the chain&#39;s 4th location and 1st location outside California.  Despite wait times often exceeding 3 hours (and my limited dining budget), it was part of my regular restaurant rotation.  <br><br>While I don&#39;t frequent the chain nearly as often as I did, it has always been a great choice for quality food and good service.<br><br>Unfortunately, today was different.  It was National Cheesecake Day but we arrived around 11am while the restaurant was still half empty.  I ordered the Spinach and Cheese dip and Cajun Jambalaya pasta.  The food was served in a timely manner and the food tasted great.  But aside from taking our initial order, our server was nowhere to be found.  We waited and waited for drink refills or for anyone to check on our table.<br><br>Once we were done with the food, we were ready to order dessert.  My dining partner ordered a cheesecake and I ordered the Apple Cobbler.  We also asked for drink refills.  A few minutes later, the server returned to inform me that the restaurant sold out of Apple Cobbler.  Not a big deal if this was a mom and pop restaurant but this is a billion dollar company that should be better at supply chain management.  Worse yet, I never got my refill.  If he hadn&#39;t taken my glass, I could have quenched my thirst with the melting ice but with no glass, I just finished my meal and ate dessert without a drink.<br><br>Our server was friendly but hardly present. Not sure if he was inexperienced or if the restaurant was understaffed.  Either way, the service was below expectations for the Cheesecake Factory.   I hope this was an isolated experience and not the new standard.

Well, if you have been to one, you have been to them all. Same great menu and service. The bartender(s) I think are better at this location the other CFs I have visited. This location seems smaller than some of the ones I have been to around the states. Again, you can&#39;t go wrong.

Not to fond of this location. Our booth we sat at had nothing but gnats and our server had major rbf (resting b face). <br><br>I had the spinach artichoke dip and the veggie burger. The dip was surprisingly very good. The burger was sloppy and falling all over the place. The taste was decent but it didn&#39;t have a component to hold it together.

Loved my server, and Kale salad. But other than that, it was s lack luster experience once again at Cheesecake Factory. I&#39;m not sure if it&#39;s a manner of kitchen staff or the training but the food is always blah for me. The last five years I&#39;ve said no to a lot of dinners at cheesecake because the standard of delicious food has gone way down. I mean from NYC to Houston, TX, none of the chains are thrilling my taste buds. Another overpriced meal that left me semi-satisfied.

First of all, this place is too dark! I can barely see anything. But the food is delicious and it&#39;s very clean so I guess it&#39;s ok. You get a big serving of food plus they bring out some warm bread while your waiting. The staff could be a little more attentive. The only annoying thing is you have to pay extra to get a different side than what&#39;s listed but overall it&#39;s a good place, especially for date night.
Standard Cheesecake factory fair, nothing good, nothing bad. Once you been to one....

I came here my first night in Atlanta as I personally couldn&#39;t decide what I wanted to eat and everybody I was with had different tastes - Cheesecake Factory has it all. I&#39;ve been before so I&#39;m familiar with their menu. The one thing I&#39;ve never had was their nachos and Mac N&#39; Cheese bites as I can get that anywhere why would I go here to get it, but alas I tried it. The nachos had a weird cheese almost like melted velveeta but thicker and not as good. Made the chips soggy and not really that great. I didn&#39;t eat much of that. The Mac N&#39; Cheese bites were pretty good but not amazing. I also got a pink cocktail drink but I can&#39;t remember the name. It was very sugary and I didn&#39;t finish it. I woke up in the middle of the night with stomach cramps and ended up becoming sick that night. The next day I felt fine and as that was the ONLY thing I ate that night I can only attribute it to that. Nobody else in my group became ill and felt fine so it might&#39;ve just been a fluke. I&#39;ve been to cheesecake factory multiple times in my life and will continue to go, just not order this particular meal again. We sat outside and the atmosphere and weather was amazing, and so was the server. Food came out very quickly as well. Everyone else enjoyed their meals I was with.<br><br>P.S. The S&#39;Mores cheesecake is AMAZING.
Great Happy Hour food choices! Drinks were ok or maybe it was my selection.  Totally fun atmosphere!

Tonight I had a sweet tooth for cheesecake. Last week I order my mom a whole 10in cherry cheesecake for her birthday. And seeing that I don&#39;t like cherry like that.. I got a few slices for me and the ole man. And of course he ate all three slices leaving me about two fork full GEESSHH!<br><br>So! Tonight my grand son and I made it a date night to eat cheesecake. Our favorites are the Red Velvet cheesecake, the Mango cheesecake, the Key lime, The Black Out cake, the Black Tie cake, the Carrot cake cheesecake. Well! I guess should have listed the whole cheesecake menu. SMH!!!!<br><br>These cake will be you loose your mind. Forget all about a diet.. Lol!!!!!

I love Cheesecake Factory. I love everything from the complimentary bread to the cheesecakes. The Steak Diane with shrimp scampi is so divine. The mashed potatoes are creamy and perfect. This is pretty much the only thing I order here because it&#39;s just so good. Their salads don&#39;t disappoint either. To end off a great meal you gotta have the red velvet cheesecake. It&#39;s not too sweet compared to their other cheesecakes on the menu. Just don&#39;t order anything else and you won&#39;t be disappointed.

Went here for lunch with my grandkids the service was  ok. My daughter asked for water without ice and it was hot. I ordered the mushroom burger that I always get and it was not that good.  My daughter had linguini with alfredo sauce and broccoli she said was just ok (now shes feeling sick) Harmonie had corn dogs &amp; fries, Truth had mashed potatoes and grilled chicken and corn they said their food was good. Maybe the dinner hour is better. Our waitress was pleasant.

This place stays consistent. I mean really the food is always good regardless of what u order. Service can be hit or miss. This past Saturday good waiter Jalani just a tad slow.<br><br>Food<br><br>Lettuce wraps...awesome<br>Mushrooms...not bad<br>Chicken Madeira...pretty good<br><br>Mall parking sucks, but hey it&#39;s at the mall...lol.

Probably one of the most overdue reviews I have ever provided.  Cheesecake Factory continues to disappoint compared to what they should be.  I have always said and this visit was no different...what they lack for in quality they attempt to make up for in quantity.  Their portions are HUGE but that is where the compliments end.  Overpriced, lackluster taste, horrible service.  Our table was about 7 inches from our neighbor, we weren&#39;t greeted by the waiter for 12 minutes, the food was subpar but the desserts were decent...not stellar but decent.  They try and do too much...when you have a novel sized menu there is no way you can excel at everything...as a result they fall short.

Interiors of this place is the first thing that attracts you when you enter. The place has inside and outside seating area and you are seated by the hostess. Menu is huge so sometimes it is very hard to make a choice. They have low calorie and gluten free options. Prices of drinks are exorbitant which is a big negative for me. A glass of mojito costed 13$+taxes, and half of the glass was filled with ice. So I probably would not go here for drinks. We ordered Nashville hot chicken tenders and chicken samosas which were really delicious and would definitely want to eat again. They serve complimentary bread which fills ur appetite. We wanted to order burgers but just went straight up for dessert, cheesecake in the Cheesecake Factory. We ordered hazelnut chocolate cheesecake which was also good. So in my opinion this place of good for food but if u dont mind paying exorbitant prices than for drinks as well.  The location of this place is also an add on, right there in perimeter mall.

Today I was at the Cheesecake Factory at Perimeter Mall at in Atlanta Georgia. I waited 10 minutes for a waiter as I had to alert the hostess. I waited 30 minutes for bread. The waiter was inconsistent as he came to check on me once during my meal. I reported it to two managers . The service was inconsistent and the spinach was bland.

I can see why the Cheesecake Factory restaurants closed most of their locations in Canada.  Yes, they have divine cheesecakes but aside from that, there is nothing special about this franchise place that was jam<br>Packed with diners.<br><br>Starting with an extensive thirty plus page menu filled with advertisements and way too many food selections; the decor is old with beige accents; very 1990&#39;s... We noticed Everyone, without exception, was leaving with a doggy bag as this is another chain where a huge amount of very average low quality food is served at somewhat &#34;affordable&#34; prices. <br><br>Our plates were uber-bland, tasteless, super salty and just not good; but they were HUGE portions loaded with unacceptable amounts of sodium and starch  - none of which are worth describing.  I will admit that the presentation on the plates looked great and very appetizing until you start eating; that&#39;s when all the built up anticipation disappears! The waiter proudly brought us a branded shopping bag with empty containers to put our hardly touched food leftovers in; no thanks! <br><br>Why the one star instead of just a zero grade? Well, the cheesecakes are truly divine and a heavenly indulgence.  There are over 33 of them on the menu! Skip the reading and head over to the refrigerated display to indulge.  <br><br>I will never dine in this franchise&#39;s restaurants again BUT,  will definitely have a cheesecake slice again and again for sure:  just calling it in ahead of time and taking it to go though!!!!

I like this place a lot. Come here all the time when I&#39;m in US. The food is good, cake is delicious and they serve great kids menu. Our family love this place. so I recommend you may try, will not let you down.

I really debated between 2 and 3 stars. I ultimately went with 3, because to get a 2 from me there usually has to be something definitively wrong with the place. And there is nothing wrong per se with Cheesecake Factory at Perimeter.  I just do not find the food special, and for the price it really should be something special.  This location is located at Perimeter Mall.  It gets pretty busy as most Cheesecake Factories. Being at a mall there is usually not a major issue parking, just a matter of how close you can get. <br><br>There are plenty of jokes around about the size of the menu at the Cheesecake Factory.  It certainly has a huge selection. I tend to suspect that is why nothing is special. If you try to be everything, then nothing is great. Some of the best places in my opinion have a few things they do, and they do them well. <br><br>Last time I went to Cheesecake Factory it was me and my wife for lunch. I had a buffalo chicken sandwich and my wife had a not memorable pasta dish. No alcohol and our bill was almost $40. <br><br>Again, nothing wrong with the food. The food was just okay and the service was fine. Going forward though when spending $40 for lunch I will be seeking out something more special.

We frequent Cheesecake factory in Birmingham and always have to wait. Today, the day we celebrate my husband&#39;s birthday, we didn&#39;t  have to wait to be seated! Our server John did well. It did take the food a little time to come out but the red velvet cheesecake along with the happy birthday song made up for it! Also, it&#39;s located at the Perimeter Mall! There&#39;s nothing like retail therapy &amp; food!

Decided to have lunch here on Friday with the family, and can&#39;t say I had a bad experience. Our waitress was awesome and on top of her job. The food came out quick and was very delicious, even had to take some to the hotel with us because we couldn&#39;t finish.
I love the cheese cake factory it&#39;s one of my favs when I go out of town because we don&#39;t have one in Arkansas

Drove in from Augusta to eat here since it&#39;s my husband&#39;s favorite. We were promptly seated at 5pm on a Saturday. Our service was fine, our waiter was very nice but didn&#39;t know the menu well. I inquired about subbing angel hair for Fettuccini Alfredo, which he confirmed was fine. When I received my order, I received dry fettuccine. I was also missing my mashed potatoes which I never received. When I kindly corrected the lady who brought the food, she thought for a second and said &#34;well...can I just bring you a side of Alfredo?&#34;. It ended up coating maybe 1/4 of the pasta, and the whole dish was luke warm. Not worth the drive.

Where do I begin....well let me first start off by saying the Perimeter Mall location is usually the best location to my husband and I. They&#39;ve never failed us until this past Sunday. When we arrived (5:30pm), they had quite a few people waiting to be seated. We went and told them the number of our party (2) and checked in. We were told there was a 10 minute wait. We stood there for maybe about 10-15 mins before our names were called to be seated. Not bad at all!!! So when they called us to seat us, we both noticed them walking us to the far left-side of the building near the kitchen area. At that time it was a lot of opened tables for both large and small parties to be seated. We looked around at the patrons awaiting a meal and they looked frustrated. We noticed why after waiting 15-20 minutes for someone to even acknowledge us. The waiters were just casually strolling around as if no one needed serving while sitting at the tables. The waiter that chose to help us took our beverage order and apologized for no one assisting us. Next, the waiter brings our beverages back...my husband tried the new &#34;Cucumber Lemonade&#34; (that&#39;s so refreshing and delicious) and I wanted my favorite Arnold Palmer! He brings the drinks out with which appeared to be sugar around the rims of our glass! But once we tasted our beverages and noticed that they were salty sweet, we then noticed that the sugar appeared to be salt! We flagged the waiter down and told him and once again he apologizes and takes the drinks away. We wait another 5 minutes and our waiter comes back out, but with no drinks! He then goes over to acknowledge a new family of 6 patrons and begins to introduce himself and take their drink order! At this point, my husband and I began to get frustrated! I think the waiter could feel our eyes piercing his soul so he turns around and say &#34;your drinks are coming right out&#34;! At this point, we thought drones were going to deliver them because he sure in the hell didn&#39;t have them and we are at a 20-30 minute wait now with no drinks nor food! He hurriedly walks away ‍ and comes back with our drinks. We taste them on the spot to make sure they are indeed right this time and they were! He asks us if we need more time to look at the food options and I think my husband and I were synchronized when saying &#34;NO&#34;! We put our orders in and sat patiently while eating bread and drinking our drinks. Another 15-20 minutes goes by and another waiter or maybe management staff brings our food out to us. He does the whole cheese shredding dance with us onto our food and we indulge finally!  By this time, we&#39;re starving and just ready to eat. We both ordered the same thing which was the &#34;Chicken Alfredo with Broccoli&#34;! The food was warm but not hot and the chicken wasn&#39;t seasoned at ALL!! I assume they felt like the salt on the glasses of our beverages would make up for the unseasoned chicken/pasta! At this point we&#39;re so hungry we just chose to season our own food with the salt/pepper shakers on the table which was fine at this point! After we finished eating it took the waiter another 20 minutes to acknowledge that we&#39;re done eating. He mozzies on over to us and because we&#39;ve sat there ample enough time waiting, we knew what Cheesecakes we wanted to order and to close out our tabs and bring the check. This location is getting just like the Lenox Mall location when it comes to wait times and customer service....POOR! We like this restaurant but have agreed to take a break from them because they are all progressively giving out poor/slow customer service!

The food was great but the service was horrible. I ask for ketchup and the server reply &#34;you wanted ketchup too&#34;. She took a long time to get the ketchup and she just drop it off and didn&#39;t even say a word. The cheese cake was amazing but it took over ten minutes for us to get it. Ask for water refill and never got it!... She need more customers service training!!! If the food was not good I would have gave it 1 start! If you decide to eat out door at night you will have cockroach for company.

I come to this location regularly to start but my friend and I ordered our food (salad and chicken sliders) and waited over an hour for our food. A manager came out after 40 minutes and said a server messed up and took our food to someone else.
