She didn&#39;t offer us anything, a discount, appetizer, etc. another 35 minutes went by and our food was still not yhete so I went up to a different manager and asked what was going on as we have waited an absurd amount of time and no one is telling us anything. Finally our food was brought out, my salad was soggy and her sliders were thrown together (barely any toppings and it was completely rushed). We immediately left especially after waiting that long for food that was soggy and thrown together. Another couple came up<br>To us and said they had to wait 2 hours for food and weren&#39;t offered anything until they said they needed something because this is ridiculous. The management and servers were awful and didn&#39;t seem to care that two different tables next to each other were waiting that long for food and nothing was offered. We live by this location and will never be back. I would rather drive to the north point location as they actually care and would never let this happen.

I dined here during the week of the fourth. I ordered the fried Mac and cheese as my appetizer and the turkey club as my entree. The fried Mac and cheese was good, fried crispy with the marinara dipping sauce. The club had fresh sliced turkey breast, not the deli kind with lettuce, tomatoes, crispy thick sliced bacon on toasted bread with an herb mayo with s side of fries. I had strawberry lemonade that was the bomb! Their portions are big you will have leftovers. This was not my first visit to this Cheesecake Factory, and like  all of the other the Cheesecake Factories I think it&#39;s over priced and you&#39;re paying for the &#34;experience &#34; of eating here. The cost of my meal and mother&#39;s meal(chicken tenders and fries) two strawberry lemonade s was $50.62.

Good, not great, not bad. We got a take out order through DoorDash. We got the bang bang chicken and shrimp and it was ok. The cheesecake was good and the salad was somewhat wilted and not fresh. Probably won&#39;t be back.
Mean mean people both male managers are very mean David and Dustin are awful don&#39;t spend your money here you won&#39;t be appreciated

Two words ( THE BEST ). I love this place. If you are in the ATL you have to come here. Now I don&#39;t think they take open table and the wait may be long but don&#39;t worry they have a mall you can go in if the waits that long, oh yeah, don&#39;t forget to try the cheese  cakes

Well, never going to this place again. We went on a Wednesday night at 630 for a party of 3. The wait was only about 10 minutes long but it was 15 minutes before the waiter even stopped by and forever to get our drinks, food, and the check at the end. Overall it was a 2 hour experience which to me is too long for a weeknight. <br><br>Such a disappointment because it was for my boyfriend&#39;s birthday and we were so fed up we didn&#39;t even get dessert. The waiter was very kind but he obviously was stretched too thin with the amount of tables he was responsible for.

Stopped here after shopping at Perimeter Mall. Having visited other locations, I entered expecting a great meal. No wait for a table, we are off to a great start. But, it stopped there. 15 minutes later, waitress stops by for drink order. 10 minutes later, we get water as requested. She asks if we need MORE time to decide? Are you crazy!<br>She takes order. We ask for bread. 10 minutes later, she is walking by. I catch her eye - BREAD! please! She brings 3 pieces of bread. We gobble it down.<br><br>At 51 minutes, food arrives. I ordered the sliders and tots. Neither was as described in the menu. We are all disappointed and ask for the check. The waitress sends the manager over. I repeat, just the check please. &#34;Do you want to take this with you?&#34; Heck no, it was not tasty when it arrived. Why would I want it later? Just send over the check, please.<br><br>The check arrives with my food removed from the bill. The kids wanted dessert. I told them to go to the counter and order. That had to be quicker than having the waitress get it.<br>There will be no return visit to this location.

My friends and I came here to celebrate someone&#39;s birthday. Since we already had dinner, we just came to have some cheesecake. This was probably the first time I had been in a Cheesecake Factory in years... and it was disappointing. <br><br>It&#39;s great that they put how much calories their food contains on their menu, but this sucked in the sense that I went from wanting a cheesecake to not wanting one at all because of how much calories are in these slices of cheesecake. The cheesecakes I originally wanted to try were all around ~1500 calories per slice... Wow, that&#39;s about all the daily caloric intake I need in one whole day. I ended up compromising for a tiramisu cheesecake which had just a little below 1000 calories. The cheesecake was just okay. It may have been in the freezer/fridge for a bit too long because the cake portion of the cheesecake had a stale fridge taste to it (like it&#39;s been soaking up the smell of whatever else was in the fridge with it). <br><br>Also, the bathroom was not clean at all and there were no toilet paper or paper towels anywhere. <br><br>I will say, the only good thing is that they were able to accommodate our large group of friends pretty last minute on a busy Saturday night.
Food was ok the real star is the cheesecake obviously! Atmosphere was nice dimly lit. The wait staff was exceptional they were attentive and helpful.

The manager stated it was red because of the marinate, but I don&#39;t think so cause when I bit into the meat it&#39;s clearly raw! My visit was on Aug 1st! We had ask for the manager cause the other wings had red on there and she kept reassuring us, oh you guys won&#39;t get sick this and that. But yeah won&#39;t be coming back to this location.

Went to pick up a couple of pieces of cheese cake to go after a long day shopping. We along with 4 other people waited over 10mins before 1 of the 2 Togo cashiers appeared. I asked the manager on duty if it was normal for BOTH  of the cashiers to be gone from the Togo side or for us to be just left standing there no host or anything to tell us someone would be with us shortly, and I was told Um yes mam as he pointed to a couple and said they&#39;re regulars just stand behind them. We finally placed our order and  made our 45min drive back home only to realize my order was wrong. I called about my order and of course got the same manager . I was told if I couldn&#39;t return that evening   There wasn&#39;t anything they could do for me despite  me explaining I would have to drive 45mins back up there. If you don&#39;t mind horrible customer service then by all means this is the place for you.

The menu here is huge!  I also noticed they had a &#39;skinnylicious&#39; menu which has items with lower calories if you&#39;re more health conscious.  It has good atmosphere and the drinks are great too.  I had the Jamaican Black Pepper Shrimp and got fries instead of rice.  The shrimp had good flavour, not spicy at all but the pepper sauce was tasty. I wasn&#39;t too keen on the black beans and marinated pineapple, I guess it didn&#39;t really go with the dish.  The burgers and sandwich were tasty too, I didn&#39;t try it though.  It was pretty good, food is decent and it&#39;s a nice place to catch up with friends.  Good location too.  On this occasion, service was a bit slow but other than that I usually enjoy this place.

Customer service is the absolute worst!! Came to celebrate a friends birthday and it turned out to be a night from hell!! The manager on duty Dustin needs some refresher courses on how to approach paying patrons and set an example for his employees. If this establishment can not handle a large crowd then they need to explain that from the very beginning. We had over an hour wait to get to our table. After being seated we still sat at the table for 15 minutes before our server took our drink orders. The whole night was a complete disaster.

If your server is Martin M, be prepared to be underwhelmed. He did not write down our order and as a result brought out my girlfriend&#39;s meal with peppers instead of without. He then, when she mentioned it but added that she just wanted to go ahead and eat, had the balls to say &#34;I can&#39;t help you if you don&#39;t tell me what you want me to do.&#34;<br><br>Needless to say, this piece of work only got a 10% tip (if that) from a fellow sever. If I pulled that shit at my place I&#39;d be out of a job. <br><br>EDITTED 6/11/2018: For some bizarre reason, I decided to go back and give these guys another try. And sadly had another underwhelming experience. The food was just okay--nothing to write home about, even if the stuffed cheddar burger was exactly what I was craving--and a server who wasn&#39;t bad... just wasn&#39;t all that good or attentive.<br><br>This is probably the last time I&#39;ll be arriving to this location. The Alpharetta location seems to have better service overall, as does the location at Lenox Mall. Something about the Perimeter location is... just not all that good.

After an exhausting day of shopping -- tough, but somebody&#39;s gotta do it! -- Ellen and I popped into the Cheesecake Factory for lunch.  I reviewed the restaurant a few years ago, and if I recall, awarded four stars.  Having ordered the same thing this time, my assessment slips a notch.<br><br>&#34;Renee&#39;s Special&#34;  (who&#39;s Renee?) is a good deal.  Half turkey or chicken salad sandwich, a bowl of soup AND a salad for $12.50.<br><br>Well looky here: they brought me a whole sandwich!  But the chicken salad was null and void.  Right proportion of chicken to mayo, but not enough zing.  Rather than a choice of soups -- surely they should have at least two -- the restaurant only prepares one per day.  Yesterday&#39;s soup du jour was &#39;loaded potato&#39;: thick, gloppy, highly caloric, not my thing.  (For what it&#39;s worth, Ellen enjoyed hers.)   The field green salad was fine -- a good-sized portion -- and the balsamic vinaigrette dressing -- &#34;on the side, please&#34; -- was excellent.<br><br>Our server was an adorable, on-the-ball college student, so we were well taken care of .<br><br>I like shopping at Perimeter, cause there are options for lunch if the food court isn&#39;t your thing.  Would I return to the Cheesecake Factory?  Sure!

Exceptionally poor service.  Took 15 minutes to get our first acknowledgment, 10 minutes to get drinks, no service in between drinks and our food took an eternity.  Luckily we asked for our check as our food was delivered so we could save 15 minutes getting the bill paid while we ate.

Recommendations: tomato basil pasta, Louisiana chicken pasta, almond-crusted salmon salad, herb crusted filet of salmon, chicken Marsala &amp; mushrooms, lemon-herb roasted chicken, Parmesan-herb crusted chicken, spicy cashew chicken,

I visited this location during Super Bowl weekend 2019. I gave the server a newly purchased VISA gift card to pay for our meal. The next day, the VISA gift card was used to make purchases online at Walmart and Amazon. Of course he would never admit to doing that. Why in the world would a thief display honesty? Beware of the scams people and safeguard your cards to include debit cards and any gift cards. I am very disappointed but it is a lesson learned for me going forward.
I came here on a busy Saturday evening with two friends. The wait wasn&#39;t that long, our food came out fast, and our service was good!

To go orders are not made correctly . Don&#39;t bother this my third time trying curbside. It is definitely not the same experience and the sizes aren&#39;t consistent in container size and I always order the same thing .

I visit Cheesecake Factory when I don&#39;t want a surprise in my meal.  It&#39;s also a safe bet when meeting picky friends for lunch/dinner because CF has something for everyone.  If a person can&#39;t find something to eat at CF, they probably have a personality disorder.  (This makes it a great first date place!)<br><br>They stopped serving my favorite snack - buffalo chicken meatballs.  They were so delicious and a perfect appetizer size.  I hate that they no longer carry them.  That being said, I console myself with the fresh kale salad and sausage and ricotta flatbread.  My favorite cheesecake is the key lime (... but I also like pumpkin when it&#39;s in season.)  I used to avoid CF because their portion sizes were so large but now with their small plate options, it&#39;s a much more reasonable place to consider for lunch or dinner.  <br><br>I&#39;m writing this review because I think people sleep on the good cocktails that are made at CF.  If you work in the area, the CF bar is a great place for happy hour.  The drink sizes are generous, suitably potent and worth their price point.  My favorites are the Mai Tai and J.W.&#39;s Lemonade. You&#39;re not drinking a &#34;crafted cocktail&#34; but you&#39;re drinking a well-made cocktail and that&#39;s okay too.<br><br>I usually sit at the bar here and service is okay.  I don&#39;t hate it but I don&#39;t love it.  They could be more attentive, but this isn&#39;t a five-star restaurant so we have to take what we get. *le sigh*<br><br>Yelp 100 #46

So unbelievably slow.  This was the final straw. <br><br>When did CF become a self service restaurant?  <br><br> Today it took my friend and I 3 hours to have lunch here.  The service was so bad I got up and went to the bar to get a refill on my iced tea because I sat for over an hour being ignored by our waiter.  It took over 30 minutes to get the drink order to begin with.<br><br>We were ignored multiple times.  Our waiter literally went to get the cheesecake order  and disappeared  completely for 45 minutes.  He only paid attention to us when we finally got a check.  Then he buzzed around us like a ravenous vulture waiting for a tip.  <br><br>I won&#39;t be back.

An annual tradition has us at Perimeter Mall, at 1130am, to enjoy a great holiday lunch during this busy season. Service was staffed accordingly as we strolled in quickly and we&#39;re seated in less than 60 seconds. <br>If anyone has ever been to this place, you know the decor, menu, bar and dessert area is all the rave. The menu boasts 45 pages at last count, with too many options for you to consider in the 5 minutes the server leaves you to decide the next phase of your journey.<br><br>Joy, our server was phenomenal! She offered her suggestions as I asked because our party of 4 has some questions and I was on the fence with going to my &#39;old trusty&#39; or venturing out to something new. We ended up with sliders, fries for a meal, fished tacos, salad/black beans, and Monte Cristo sandwiches. <br>The hibiscus lemonade is the bomb-not too sweet and won&#39;t send you into diabetic shock, lol.<br><br>Considering we were ordering dessert, we definitely wanted to snag some cheesecake on out way out, we ate light today.<br><br>When the food arrived, it came out hot, fast and correct. This establishment rarely gets the order wrong, although I admit I almost ordered my son&#39;s food incorrect if I had not been reminded to add cheese to his sliders, and just ketchup and nothing else. Our server Joy was very friendly and gracious and make the adjustment immediately. <br>As I stated before, we arrived before noon, so we saw a ample supply of empty tables, however that changed by noon- almost 50% capacity. The bar boasts a big screen TV where you&#39;re invited to chat with the bartender or servers. The temperature was nice enough for outdoor seating although I wasn&#39;t sure if that&#39;s an option this time of year.<br><br>We ended our experience on our way out and ordered some cheesecake. The original, and the pumpkin pecan. Yummy!<br><br>Healthscore-91<br>Service-Phenomenal<br>Restrooms-1 Handicap, 3 stalls fully stocked and clean<br>Managers-Available, Visible, and Engaging <br>Parking You&#39;ll have to ride around once or twice. The mall parking is ridiculous so what can you do?

Quite the different experience we had at the Cheesecake factory today.  Can&#39;t say I was impressed at all with this location.  You would think with all the competition near by they would be on top of things... but guess not.  <br><br>Anyway for a Tuesday evening around 6:30pm, there was no wait and my friend and I were sat in a small booth in the back by the windows...  As we were deciding on what we wanted to eat, we noticed flies kept buzzing around our table... I ended up killing one on the window but more kept coming and along the window seal my friend pointed out lots of dead little bugs... Gnats, flies... yeah so I wanted to move immediately... Should&#39;ve take that as a hint to leave the restaurant completely but we were starving and wanted a quick bite before the movies and The Pub was packed.... should&#39;ve tried The Cowfish place... <br><br>So we move to another table... no bugs near by but they cleared the table we left and reset it like nothing happened... they didn&#39;t even clean the window seal after we&#39;d pointed out there were dead bugs on it...  I felt bad for the people they sat at the table right after us... I could still see little flies buzzing around that window... <br><br>So we decide on our food and while we wait we munch of the regular ol&#39; bread they bring out... The wheat bread was fine, but the sourdough was odd, so we just picked at it...  It didn&#39;t take long for our food to come out and initially everything looked ok but it just went to meh in a hand basket as we started to eat.  <br><br>I ordered the factory nachos, which I&#39;ve ordered numerous times before and they came out luke warm with globs and Globs of cheese melted on top... I ate what I could but it turned into a soggy unappetizing mess before I could get a quarter of the way through them.  There was a pool of grease underneath the pile of soggy chips and I just gave up.  I drank my strawberry lemonade and waited for my friend to finish the chicken sandwich she wasn&#39;t really happy with.  She said the chicken was falling apart and not in a good way... It was probably reheated from earlier... she said the toppings didn&#39;t help it either...  <br><br>Anyway as we were leaving the restaurant, I told her next time we come back to Perimeter Mall... I wouldn&#39;t be suggesting Cheesecake factory at all... Just a bad experience all around and their saving grace was the super nice server we had...  Only saving grace... only.  So many other options to choose from at Perimeter and after today even the foodcourt will be an option before we come back here...

Came here on a Tuesday evening for dinner with my coworkers. The wait was not long at all. Our entire party wasn&#39;t there yet, so most of us had to be there to be seated. <br><br>Our server seemed quite rude and stand-off-ish. From the moment should spoke to us, she didn&#39;t seem so friendly. Weird because we&#39;re a friendly group haha. There were little things that bothered us about her, especially her serving etiquette. Our last person came late, and he literally had to stand even though we asked for a chair the moment we sat down. He went to the bathroom and came back, and we still didn&#39;t have a chair yet. We ended up having to flag down a hostess to bring us a chair. If you requested anything from her, she would walk away without saying a word. We received our appetizers but no plates, so we had to flag someone else down for plates. Then for dessert, I asked for plates with forks and she gave me just plates. <br><br>I ordered the steak diane with shrimp scampi. The portion of steak is very small, but the portion of shrimp and mashed potatoes is plenty. The shrimp scampi is not what I&#39;m accustomed to. I assumed it would be sautéed shrimp in a butter and garlic sauce, but it was breaded shrimp in a creamy sauce. Not a fan. <br><br>I haven&#39;t been to a Cheesecake Factory in awhile, so I remember the slices of cheesecake being humongous, but I guess they&#39;re a lot smaller now. Still tastes good though.<br><br>For appetizers, if you like buffalo chicken, then I highly recommend the Buffalo Blasts. Its shredded buffalo chicken with cheese then deep fried. It&#39;s a huge portion! About 6 large triangular pieces served with bleu cheese and buffalo sauce.

I grew up in he area. This Cheese cake factory had been a staple in my life. I&#39;ve had 2 family members work here. So I occasionally drop in to sit and the bar and grab some beer or a slice of cake but never both cause I feel like that wouldn&#39;t taste good together. They might. I haven&#39;t tried. I like the place. The menu is hilariously large so me trying to try everything on the menu who do be a task. I&#39;ve had most cheesecakes though. Of course #1. And unlike Drake, my girl doesn&#39;t fight me at cheesecake, so I love to go there.  yayyy! Rap lyrics in a review, you&#39;re welcome.

This place has significantly gone down hill.  Went with some friends to celebrate a Birthday this week and the service was below average.  The draft beer was flat and the server had no clue about what flat beer on Tap meant.  Requested another kind of beer on draft and took forever to get. The food we ordered was spicy and it was sent out regular. When we asked the server about it, she took it back to the kitchen and they added red chill flakes on top and sent it back. I had to call the Manager and get it remade, which took another 20+ minutes.  To end it all, the bill was incorrect and had to sort it out.  I will NOT be going back again go this location. B- grade at best!!

Amazing cheesecake! Been coming here for years. I&#39;ve had a variety of experiences. Today&#39;s experience was one of the best, but I have to remember cheesecake factory is a chain. Now if you&#39;re rating just the cheesecake - 5 stars!!! yum! Best cheesecake. If you&#39;re rating the service -- today I would give 5 stars also. I have had bad experiences at this location in the past though. Some servers have given attitude when I am not buying 3-course meals and just an appetizer and dessert. The food depends on what I have gotten. It&#39;s usually ok, but I always have to remember that this place receives awards for how much sodium is in their food and highest caloric content of chains. I guess it&#39;s different to go to a nice restaurant and not know how many calories you&#39;re ingesting and to go to a place where their calories are published online :P.<br><br>But in all seriousness, it&#39;s a great place for birthdays, family dinners, celebrations, catch-ups. It&#39;s easy to talk. There&#39;s music, but its not too loud. They have strong drinks and HUGE portions, and there is a lot of variety in their items!<br><br>I&#39;ve had their chicken marsala, peanut butter chicken (forgot name, but similar), one of their fried tuna sushi appetizers (Best i&#39;ve ever had), and a couple of other things in the past. =)

This review is based solely on the cheesecake alone because that&#39;s all I ate and I also took it to go. But let me say the cheesecake was what I imagined it would be. Amazing!!  So many delicious options to choose. We got the vanilla bean,  tuxedo, extreme Oreo,  and red velvet. All were good but the Oreo won this one with red velvet at a close 2nd (they could leave the white chocolate shavings off the back though). However I gave 4 stars because the price is outrageous. 5 pieces of cheesecake for almost $50. That&#39;s crazy. Got to try it at least once though.
I love their tiramisu cheesecake, it&#39;s always a perfect dessert choice whenever I have the chance to be in the area.

There are only two things that I must have at the Cheesecake Factory. One being the avocado egg rolls and the other.... Bang Bang Chicken &amp; Shrimp! If you&#39;re a peanut sauce lover this dish is for you. My experience at this location was nice. They sat our party of 3 once we walked in. There was no wait time. Plus, our server Alicia was on time with the water refills. Her service was more than awesome! I really didn&#39;t have any hang-ups with this visit. Only hope that one day my favorite dish (Bang Bang Chicken &amp; Shrimp)  will soon end up on the lunch menu. As of now, the portion size is enough for two servings.

This place is perfect for a date night or night with friends! The menu is huge with many options. I recommend the flavored lemonades, cheesecakes, and pastas when you come here. The food tastes amazing and this place is always a go to! The main con is service can be very slow, waiting times can be long, and the food tends to be on the pricier side. Would definitely recommend this place to my friends though.

Cheesecake Factory should not surprised anyone. It is after all a chain. I am giving it 3 stars since I think we received excellent service by Our server Kwame and the food was just ok and a little bit pricey for what it was. We ordered a flatbread and a chili to share. We also got one slice of cheesecake. I still ended up paying around $20 even with a $25 gift certificate.<br><br>Still, the food was consistent. The chili was really tasty. The flatbread was OK, nothing special but it tasted ok. The pumpkin cheesecake was of course very tasty. Can&#39;t go wrong with that! Having said that, it looks like the cheesecake portions are getting smaller.<br><br>It&#39;s the Cheesecake Factory so you should have a good idea of what to expect. The service was really good, the food average.
Amazing service and great food. They were out of the appetizer we wanted but the second choice was much better than the first choice would be.

Came here for lunch on a Sunday and only had to wait 10 minutes which was a pleasant surprise. This was my first time eating at Cheesecake Factory and I enjoyed the vibe of the place. The waitress was super friendly and took our order promptly. The food did take some time to come out (about 20-30 minutes) but portions were huge. I ordered the skinnylicious veggie burger which was a combination of rice and black beans. While I was skeptical about how good this burger would be given that it was on the low-cal side, it was quite good--not dry and flavorless like many diet options. I also got the oreo cheesecake which was amazing! Overall, great place and I would definitely visit again. Excited to try the brunch menu next time!

it&#39;s always really hard for me to review a chain restaurant like Cheesecake Factory, but I&#39;m going to give it a shot. I always remember Cheesecake Factory as HUGE portions for the price you pay. I prefer getting the classics, and you can&#39;t go wrong with the Shepherd&#39;s Pie or the Meatloaf. Any of the pastas aren&#39;t bad as well. Everything here is quite heavy, and the cheesecakes are intimidating but the best (and unhealthiest) dessert ever. RED VELVET CHEESECAKE ftw. They offer a Skinny menu for healthier eating... but when you&#39;re at the Cheesecake Factory, why bother, just go all the way :) <br><br>Service is usually pretty good here. Although it&#39;s quite busy, I&#39;ve never had to wait more than 10-20 minutes for a table, whatever the size of our group is (I&#39;ve never been during a peak hour before though so that may be an inaccurate estimate). The servers are usually nice and friendly. One of my friends dropped his flatbread seconds after the server delivered it to our table. Although I&#39;m sure both parties were at fault (the server set it down dangerously close to the edge, and my slightly buzzed friend brushed past the platter when standing up to go the bathroom, they quickly moved to replace it free of charge, as it should be. Drinks take a while to be served, so I advise ordering them early on so you&#39;re not chugging it near the end of your meal.

Went here on a Saturday night and was told the wait would be roughly 45 minutes for a party of two. To my surprise, the actual wait was more like 20min which was great since I was starving.<br><br>Service was decent and the food was great. They didn&#39;t have the strawberry cheesecake I wanted for desert so I settled for plain.<br><br>Overall, it was a great experience and I will be back.

I had Brunch at this location this past Saturday usually I  enjoy every meal;  however, the Chicken and Belgian Waffle entree  were substandard.  The chicken tenders had no taste and were fried too hard and the Waffle tasted nothing like a Belgian Waffle. Please DON&#39;T ORDER THIS ENTREE YOU WILL BE DISAPPOINTED!!!

I&#39;ve been to this locations several times for dinner, lunch and happy hour. There is ample parking as this location is pretty much at the mall. As usual for Cheesecake Factory the restaurant is massive with a massive menu. My bf always gets the fettuccini Alfredo with a meat and broccoli. He must like it since it&#39;s the 4th time he ordered it. I like the fettuccine noodles they use, the sauce is pretty good too. They do tend to skimp on the meat and broccoli though. I had the skinny chopped salad which was pretty tasteless and had some brown romaine hearts in it. Portions are super large here so I suggest ordering off the lunch menu if you can. Prices are reasonable because of the portion sizes. Wait staff has been pretty consistent with pretty good service. Food comes out hot and promptly. Taste wise the food is average at best. Happy hour prices are great on food (get the burger!) and ok on drinks.  Oddly enough I&#39;ve never had the cheesecake. It&#39;s probably because I&#39;m always so full after my entree. All around a solid place to eat but it won&#39;t wow you. Enjoy!

My last meal for 2015 was at the Cheesecake Factory!<br>My first meal for 2016 was from? ... Yup you guessed it, Cheesecake Factory!<br>This is because you get such a large portion and yes the food is great.<br>Be it a busy NYE dinner or a regular lunch date, I&#39;ve always enjoyed good service here.<br><br>Cheesecake has a $5 happy hour menu that can&#39;t be beaten.  They have a select number of specialty cocktails and apps, that&#39;s more than enough to keep you satisfied. In addition to this their small plates/snack menu during happy hour ranges from $6-7 with so many choices you can&#39;t go wrong.  The menu is only available at the bar area but there is adequate seating.<br><br>Ironically though, I must confess... I haven&#39;t had their cheesecake.... shhh. I&#39;m usually so stuffed that I forfeit dessert. Next time though I&#39;ll be sure to grab a slice, promise :)<br><br>Menu 5/5<br>Service 4/5<br>Taste 4/5<br>Location 5/5

I have to say that I was really disappointed with the service that I and my family received this time, Went in to have dinner with my mother inLaw and Sister. Was seated right away but our waitress took a while to come to our table, when she finally came she asked what we would like to have to drink. I ordered a mojito and a water and lemons, my mother ordered a water with SEVERAL LEMONS, my sister ordered the same. She came back with our water and about 5 thinly sliced lemons. <br>Then asked us if we wanted to order any appetizers which I did, I ordered the buffalo blast and she brought us some bread. <br><br>Ok here is where it gets a little rough.....she brought the appetizer and asked if we were ready to order. I ordered the Greek salad and my sister was trying to figure out what she had the last time she was there, asked the waitress some questions about the entree and after about 3 mins she placed her order. My mother still had not decided what she wanted so we told the waitress to just put our order in and give my mother a little time. The waitress did not say anything and turned away with an attitude like we bothered her by not being able to place our whole order.  .....ok O_o<br><br>The waitress comes back in about 10 mins and ask my mother if she was ready and my mother told her that she was ok and would just be full off of the appetizer and bread. Note; my mother is a really fit chick that doesn&#39;t really like to eat after 9pm. <br><br>So the waitress then tells us she is going to put me and my sisters order in..... What?! <br>We thought she had done that already when she took our order the first time. <br><br>And way after that we sat there for a good 40 mins watching other people that arrived after U.S. Get their food. Our waitress not one time came to check on us or tell us that our food would be coming shortly.<br><br>So after I seen her walk by U.S. A few times I politely asked her &#34;ma&#39;am can tell us when our food would be coming&#34;? She said she would go check on it.<br>Please tell me why she came back by our table and totally ignored us? Didn&#39;t say your food is taking a little long, didn&#39;t say anything! Just walked right by us.<br><br>I decided to go in and speak with a manager and I told him what happened, he was very nice and asked if we still wanted our food, my mother comes out and I told him to just give us the check for our table because we had waited too long already. He offered to pay for my drink and appetizer and we left.<br><br>I Looooove The Cheesecake Factory and this will not stop me from going back, I just hope the young lady that served us poorly gets it together. <br>Other than our service the restaurant is very nice looking.

Worst Cheesecake Factory I have ever been too. Today I went after Sunday Brunch to get some Cheesecake. The waitress is why the whole experience was bad. She only came to the table 3 times, for drink order, the food order, and the bill. We waited 35 minutes for cheesecake that was already cooked and only had to be plated. Never refilled my drink and was rude the whole time. Would not recommend this because the manager said she did not see the problem after I asked to speak with her. The one near the mall of Georgia is probably better.

You can find this location of the Cheesecake Factory at 4400 Ashford Dunwoody Rd NE, Atlanta, GA 30346 towards the northeastern corner of Perimeter Mall (far right when facing the main entrance from Ashford Dunwoody Rd). Parking is easiest from the lot to the right in front of Dillards department store and walking across, unless you want to pay the valet but you&#39;ll still end up walking a bit so I&#39;d advise you to forego that inconvenience.<br><br>I have a feeling that most of you have had the experience of the Cheesecake Factory - the first built (and now closed and replaced by a different location) in Buckhead at one time was the highest-grossing restaurant in the US. I believe this location was the second or third built in Atlanta and it&#39;s a really fantastic location. The interior has a fantasy array of Byzantine columns, wonderful fantasy-like wall sconces and very feminine fresco-like murals on a warm tan stucco adorning the ceilings - quite nice and it will make you feel a bit like you&#39;ve entered a Disney theme park restaurant, however much like said-park the experience hardly meets the promise. I&#39;ve worked in this area of Dunwoody for 15 or so years off-and-on so I&#39;ve had many occasion to eat at this Cheesecake Factory. It&#39;s not a bad place to meet for special occasions as they can accommodate large parties - for my most recent visit I met with many coworkers for a bittersweet occasion - a member of our team was leaving for another work opportunity.<br><br>When you are seated you&#39;ll be presented with a booklet of many, many items and now I&#39;ll voice my biggest gripe. The menu is much too large - I mean it&#39;s so big that there&#39;s advertising on some of the pages - is it a menu, or a catalog? I really don&#39;t see how any restaurant can offer so many dishes and hope to do all of them well. The last thing I want to see is a binder full of pages - where do you start? What&#39;s good? What&#39;s not? Too many choices. <br><br>The food here, and I&#39;ve tried dozens of items, is passable - no real standouts from the many appetizer or entree sections. I honestly can&#39;t recommend any one item as something that&#39;s your missing or something you can&#39;t get elsewhere and I think this is where the restaurant&#39;s identity takes a hit. You&#39;re sitting in this fantastic setting yet with one exception, the food is pretty humdrum. We&#39;ll get to that exception shortly. I do like the basket of bread that they bring out - something about that wheat bread I really like. But then again, don&#39;t come here for the bread. When I think about the food here it reminds me a bit of TGI Fridays. Not that they are all that similar, but the food is very formulaic which is both a good and bad thing. It&#39;s good in that there&#39;s usually some semblance of food balance - starch to fat to acid ratios are good. It&#39;s bad in that the combinations are a bit tired - not much magic here. For mall food it&#39;s good and certainly better than the food court - of course you&#39;re paying more for it as well. Back to the Fridays comparison - I think the food here is better than Friday&#39;s as it&#39;s less snacky and more of a meal. Satisfying but not awesome.<br><br>The exception of course are the desserts. I am not a big fan of cheesecake - it tends to sit very heavy with me, but I&#39;ll concede that the cheesecakes here are exceptional. I also like the Sunday and the ice cream in general. And maybe that&#39;s the point - I mean it is called &#34;The Cheesecake Factory&#34; so perhaps everything leading up to the dessert is just the build up to the big finish? But if so, why the phone-book menu?<br><br>My final point is about the service. I find it very hit-or-miss. I&#39;ve received both exceptional service and horrible service and it doesn&#39;t seem to matter what size the party is - sometimes the service is amazing on a group of 20 and terrible on just two. No rhyme or reason for it. I&#39;ve had so many orders get screwed up here and it&#39;s really unclear if it was the server or the kitchen. I&#39;ve had tables where everything showed up together except one lost plate and it took 20 minutes for it to appear with everyone either finished or sitting in front of cold plates, to wrong items showing up, to meals with food restrictive (bacon) items showing up with extra (bacon), etc. When service is good the server is usually very attentive and fixes any mistakes quickly. When service is bad you can&#39;t find the server and the attitude is really crappy. Like I said, hit-or-miss.<br><br>So what&#39;s my final overall opinion? I think The Cheesecake Factory is exceptional for their desserts. The appetizer and entrees are mediocre but palatable and certainly better than mall food. The service hit-or-miss. Would I eat there again? Sure as it&#39;s close and useful for certain situations. Do I find myself wanting to go here? No. On a scale of 1-5, it&#39;s a fairly solid 3 due to the desserts.<br><br>(also published to my food blog)

even though our last visit was sub par my boyfriend wanted the parm chicken pizza so we tried it out again. <br>everything was definitey better this time. service was good at the beginning and i guess everyone wanted their check at once so it was slow towards the end but better service than last time. our food came out and it was very good. boyfriend got his pasta pizza and i got a burger. it was cooked perfectly and i got my salad dressing on the side cause last time my greens were drenched. my boyfriends pizza was good he said not as much meat as last time but it was still really good.

Until today, I had only visited this restaurant since around 1995.  I recall enjoying my meal, but I didn&#39;t love the overcrowded atmosphere.  I only visited this restaurant today because it was my mother&#39;s birthday and she loves the place.  Our party of four was promptly seated and our drink orders were taken immediately.  Service was perfect.<br><br>I am very picky about the way salmon is cooked, but my miso salmon was cooked to perfection. It was served with about 8 snow peas, rice and a sauce.  I&#39;m pretty sure that it was the healthiest thing on the menu.  The salads are not healthy.  One person in our party ordered a chicken salad.  It was huge and included fried onion rings and tons of cheese.  My elderly mother and her friend had the appetizer chicken fingers with potatoes and they loved them.  Their dishes were so huge that they had leftovers.<br><br>I have two problems with this restaurant.  First, the dishes are so huge that they are unappetizing to me. The second problem I have is with the size of the bathrooms.  There are three small stalls and a very small standing area in a restaurant that is large enough to probably seat 500 to 1,000 people.

Had a not so good experience here tonight. Service was awful, food was over cooked, and some of it didn&#39;t come out until after we&#39;d asked to cancel the order. It very could have been a catastrophe of errors with the server being triple sat, tables around us being really demanding, and the kitchen messing up our orders.... but it&#39;s really hard to sit around with 4 empty glasses while our server walks by without glancing our way multiple times.

I had a great experience at this location! We walked in on a Friday night and the wait was only 30 min. We were told that if we see an opening at a high top table, we could go seat ourselves. After 15 minutes of waiting, a high top table opened so we sat down. The service was great. Our waitress Portia (sorry if misspelled!) was great! She was really attentive and was very helpful to us. She really made the experience here a 5 star experience. The food came out quickly and was delicious. I am only visiting Atlanta for the weekend but if I ever come back, I would definitelyyyyy return to this location!

Poor customer service. Ordered lunch / delivery courtesy of Grub Hub. Grub Hub not the problem. It took the Cheesecake Factory almost 2 hours to complete my order-- I cancelled the delivery-- lost a customer Cheesecake perimeter mall.

We had not been to Cheesecake Factory in years but went as it was my daughter&#39;s birthday and wanted a place where everyone could find something on the menu that they liked. Unfortunately the food came out rather cold and bland. The server seemed annoyed when I asked if they did something for kids birthdays. The website clearly states they will bring a little kids ice-cream scoop. My daughter wore a tiara that said birthday girl so it was clear we were celebrating. Oh well.

The food is always amazing here. The servers are extremely helpful too. With such an extensive menu, this is especially important!.. I had order something new and she double checked to make sure i knew what i was getting then suggested a better option. Definitely try the salmon egg rolls and miso salmon. It&#39;s incredible!!<br><br>I soooo miss there blueberry mojito. Their Reese&#39;s cheesecake is awesome tho btw.

Overall not bad. When you first walk in you are submerged in an exquisite atmosphere of egyptian-esque architecture and design. The tables are candlelit and made out of granite. I was seated very quickly on a Friday at around 6pm but we were only a party of 3. Once we sat down we were greeted within 3 min by our waiter. We had to ask for them to bring out the complimentary bread. The appetizers were amazing (corn tamales and fried zucchini). While ordering we asked the waitress what she preferred between a couple different dishes and she wouldn&#39;t give us a straight answer. She just kept telling us what the dish was.  Not how good or bad it was. We waited for the food for about 10-15 min until only two of our plates arrived and the third member of our party had to wait about another 8 min until his food arrived. I had the chicken Parmesan &#34;pizza style&#34;. It was basically a pizza except the dough was breaded chicken.  The flavor wasn&#39;t that great I probably wouldn&#39;t get it again. I have been here before and other dishes are really good.  I definitely recommend giving it a shot.

We stopped here for a quickish bite to eat, we should&#39;ve just gotten cheesecake to go and been done with it. Our server had an attitude the second we sat, they were out of the first drink I tried to order. I asked for a few minutes to look over the drinks since there wasn&#39;t any sangria and placed an order for chicken samosas. It took another 10-15 minutes for the serve to come back and get my drink order, and another server brought our appetizer. It took 37 minutes to get my bottle of Michelob Ultra, and STILL not from our server, I asked a random server walking by, clearly it had been sat waiting at the bar on me because it was flat and warm. After that yet again, someone else brought our food....it took over 45 minutes for our server to check on us and hastily throw the check at us meanwhile we had almost empty water glasses. Mind you the entire time our waiter was chatting it up with his other tables and completely ignoring us. Honestly this was some of the worst service I&#39;ve ever received and the food was mediocre, I don&#39;t know if we&#39;ll be returning to another Cheesecake Factory after tonight. We still tipped 23%  even though the guy didn&#39;t attempt to provide decent service.

Food was so-so (3 stars out of 5).  It&#39;s a typical Cheesecake Factory location with a menu so large, you really don&#39;t know what to get.<br><br>We got the banana cream cheesecake and the chocolate turtle cream cheesecake, both of which were pretty good at first, but were doused in whipped cream so it was a bit overwhelming.<br><br>Service was what drove this place to be 1 star.  We were there in a group of four in what should have been a 60-75m dinner, but turned out to be 2H.  The service was just flat out slow.  Multiple times, we were looking around for our server and he was nowhere to be found.  We ended up having to pour our own water at one point.  The first time was between the bread and the entrees, and we saw him chatting with another server.  The second time was after our entrees were finished and we wanted to order cheesecake and he was nowhere to be found.  When we finally wanted to order cheesecake, he mentioned it would be faster to get it out front (but we said we wanted to eat it there).<br><br>Just to get the check took another chunk of time.  Overall, the meal got dragged out longer than necessary.  Thank goodness for the good company!
My favorite spot for slow customer service!<br>On the plus they still have a wide variety....of food and service....

We live about an hour from this restaurant and we were soooo excited about finally having cheesecake from here Bc we were in the area. We visited this location on a Saturday night. It was busy. I knew we&#39;d have to wait...but it was a pretty awful experience. Waited 35 min for a table. Then they sat me and my daughter in a crap half booth/table...almost like dining with strangers since we were right on top of them. Our server was nowhere to be found. When he did come around he brought bread before our drinks- with no butter. I ordered a salad before my meal- at the 40 min mark I asked him if I was going to get it since he&#39;d come by and say something like &#34;your food is coming out soon!&#34; His reponse was that he couldn&#39;t remember which table had ordered a salad! I was over it...so while waiting on our food I ordered cheesecake online ( it&#39;s actually the best thing ever if your server sucks!) food was half cold when it arrived but whatevs we were hungry. 1 Star Bc the cheesecake to go order was ready when they said it would be and they were awesome at the Togo counter. Lesson learned...just order dessert and skip the dinner!!

My coworker asked for cheese on their sandwich and they literally took the plate and put a slice on the burger placed the entire plate with vegetables in the microwave and brought it back. A party of 10 and everyone had individual issues.

This location is horrible. I will NEVER come back, they were out of the bread that the servers give you when you first get there. I got pasta and the chicken wasn&#39;t all the way cooked. Service was horrible. Never again

Ok just so you know i&#39;m not picking on them for no reason Neil my server was a sweetheart.<br><br>This is more to do with the way i was treated from when i walked in. <br><br>The hostess didn&#39;t introduce herself, didn&#39;t welcome me to the cheesecake factory did not say thank you and moved 2 people in front of me even though i was the first one in! This happens a lot in Georgia the only thing i can assume is because i am not of the same ethnicity. Coming from the west coast this has never been a problem but it happens all the time only with women in Georgia.<br><br>Then the girl who seated me actually went out of her way not to give me what i wanted. I asked if i could sit in a booth and was told there is no server in that section, and low and behold there are now people sitting in that area. Maybe its just me but i think her attitude and LACK OF CUSTOMER SERVICE stinks. I&#39;m just visiting Atlanta and this will be the last time i will come to the Cheesecake Factory here. <br><br>I thought we were all born equal! apparently not. This needs addressing by management.The time of my visit is 6pm the date is May 16th 2017 you should be able to work out who the two girls are. Very Disappointing. I love Cheesecake factory on the west coast we have none of these issues in California.<br><br>Neil the Server is very nice, attentive and polite. His customer service is excellent. I can&#39;t praise him enough.
The food was really good . The server wasn&#39;t too friendly . It was a party of 17 maybe he was overwhelmed . But the food was great and came out in a timely manner .

I had the Super Food salad. It was soooo good. And good for me. They have a very extensive menu here and a crazy amount of cheese cakes, every one in your party should be able to find something they&#39;ll like on the menu. <br><br>It takes me a long time to figure out what I want to eat, so I usually pick it out on the online menu ahead of time.<br><br>I feel reviewers are slightly biased against chains - keep that in mind when you view a chain restaurant&#39;s score. Reviewers favor restaurants that are not well known- it&#39;s like a hipster mentality thing. They give these novel one - of - a - kind spots raving reviews, and then when you go there, you&#39;re like, why was everyone raving about that? There&#39;s a reason why there are 20,000 MacDonalds, but every MacDonalds somehow has a 2 star rating *thoughtful finger on chin emoji*. You know where chain restaurants actually rack up big points? Consistency. Expert designed recipes. Ability to comp over slight dissatisfactions. Coupons and specials. Rarity does not equal higher quality- the reverse is actually more likely.

Almost every Cheesecake Factory I go to seems to always be packed. The Perimeter Mall location is not really an exception, you might be able to eat at a lull sometimes but I&#39;ve seen this place be busy at 3 PM or 9 PM, so it&#39;s a bit of a crapshoot.<br><br>Cheesecake factory always has a huge menu of options, like any place with so many options you&#39;ll get some things that are better than others. The fried mac and cheese appetizers are really good, they give you 4 and that will fill 2 people up before any entree itself. I&#39;ve had entrees like chicken parm, philly cheesesteak, and some of the pasta dishes. I think overall the quantity is huge, they give you a lot for what you&#39;re paying. The food doesn&#39;t always taste quite cohesive, for example the philly cheesesteak has too many large peppers that kind overpower the meat.<br><br>Service and quality can be variable sometimes, when it gets busy it can be hard to get a waiter or waitress, and i agree with some of the comments that you might notice a few dirty plates/utensils because they didn&#39;t clean it well (perhaps they just put it in a washer without scrubbing completely). I do think they try to make the place clean but with so much foot traffic the quality of cleanliness seems to drop sometimes.<br><br>Overall it kinda does feel like a factory, there&#39;s large quantities of decent food at ok prices, but a lot of small details can get overlooked with service and cleanliness.

Seated and waited over 20min... still have not seen our server. Party of 20 seated 10 min after us and has a server!!!!! DISGUSTING. We are here celebrating our daughters birthday. I am so saddened at the disappointment she is feeling. Terrible and inexcusable!!!

I must have bad luck because this the second Cheesecake Factory I&#39;ve been to and had a bad time. This location want you to pay for a dinner  but gives you a lunch portion. I got the Thai coconut chicken, but substitute it for salmon. The salmon was the size of my toddler fist. My husbands a police officer and he said that&#39;s a snack for our daughter. We ask to speak to the manager, Mr.Hue, and he said we would have to pay even more fir salmon. If I&#39;m already paying extra for a piece of salmon at least let me get my moneys worth!

Came on a very busy night.  Our waiter Martin was quick and on top of everything. We ordered the buffalo blasts, tuna tartare, and pork belly sliders.  The pork belly sliders were amazing!!!!!  Will definitely come back when in the area.

I am not a huge fan of chain restaurants, but I went here on a whim one day and was impressed. The Thai lettuce wraps were really good, and I would recommend getting them if you want a fun and seemingly healthier appetizer option.

Food was great. Martini&#39;s were strong. <br><br>Loosing a star because the patio could use some cleaning. All of the chairs had bird shit on them. When you&#39;re spending $100 on a late lunch you expect a comfortable clean environment.

My mommy wanted a slice of vanilla bean cheesecake and begged me to go with her to Cheesecake Factory after shopping--how can you say &#34;no&#34; to mommy???<br><br>We walked in and they were just as busy as the Cheesecake Factory in the Bay...slammed!  We walked past the people waiting and went into the bar area where we could easily grab a hightop table for a quick drink and slice of cheesecake.  <br><br>Our server greeted us quickly and brought the coffee, cocktails and cheesecake just as fast.  What a great idea!<br><br>I cannot speak for the actual meals, as we had already eaten; however, I can vouch for the cheesecake.  The cheesecake is always so good, no matter which location you visit, and consistency is really a key to success in any restaurant.  I am not a big sweets person, but I will always have &#34;just one bite&#34; with my companions.  I like the fact that I always know what I will be getting with the desserts at Cheesecake Factory.<br><br>Still catching up on my Thanksgiving reviews....thank you for being patient.  This was before that awful foot surgery...I am just happy I could visit my fam and teach them about yelp.<br><br>Stephani Smiles for CF ;)

We must&#39;ve picked the worst possible time to go here- very disappointed. <br>Hostesses ignored us, and after a 45 minutes wait on lunch we left. <br>I had talked a group into going there, and was embarrassed <br>I hate to see this, having enjoyed the place many , many times

I haven&#39;t eaten at the Cheesecake Factory in over 5 years. There wasn&#39;t anything on their menu I enjoyed eating. Someone told me they have a new &#34;super food&#34; menu. <br><br>I went there and tried their vegan salad. Have to say it was down right good. They have gained a customer back. I will try their other salads.

The worst experience I ever had! This is by far the worst Cheesecake Factory. CF is well known for it&#39;s consistency due its standard ingredients and recipes, however they forgot that the quality of workers is equally important.<br>- Bad chefs: Eggs Benedict - poached eggs or hard boiled eggs? A local diner can do this better. Breakfast for 4 people took 45min for the food. We are not talking about peak hours. It was 10:50am! <br>- Bad service staff: even after I complained about the food, she still included full amount for something I didn&#39;t eat in the bill. <br>- The WORST manager: this is the root cause of everything. Their management is really bad. I called the manager and explained my experience. He had no facial expression and he did NOT say the word &#34;sorry&#34; at all. It was surprising to see that in the service industry! Maybe they think they will get business no matter what because they are in a popular area, but I will not come back to this place any more.

I really enjoyed the Chicken Madeira.  It was seasoned very well with perfectly prepared asparagus on top of it.  The mushrooms were tender and delicious, in a beautiful mushroom sauce.  <br><br>The ambiance was just right for our group of 25.  Our food was hot, with the exception of my potatoes.  <br><br>The staff was very attentive and professional.  I enjoyed the entire experience!<br><br>I will definitely be back!

The cakes are always great, favorite dish here is the Chicken piccata, but the Chicken Riesling is a close second. Nice addition to the menu.<br><br>Only drawback is how busy the place gets on the weekends, it&#39;s a madhouse. It&#39;s recommended to put your name on the list and plan to wait. Take a walk or simply have something to do while you wait.

I&#39;m glad this location is close because it&#39;s always a go to when we can&#39;t decide where to go and we are never disappointed. It usually stays pretty busy but it&#39;s a huge place so room for everyone. The outside seating is awesome and I try to sit out there when it&#39;s open. Food is always amazing! Mac and cheese balls appetizer is good and enough for everyone. I&#39;ve never been disappointed with anything. If you have room there have ton of dessert options (duh) I always take some to go! Parking is all over the place but it shares a lot with other restaurants and a mall so it can be trying depending on Day and time.

We were in town for a baseball game that was rained out.  So we came here for dinner before heading back to NC.  We didnt have to wait for a table and was seated when we came in.  Everyone we encountered was friendly.  We ordered and food didnt take long to come out.  I got the Orange chicken which I loved and it was not spicy, and it comes with rice.  The amount of chicken is about right for one person, but I had some rice left over.  I also had the White Choc Raspberry Cheesecake and it was AMAZING!  Our waitress was very nice, and always back and forth to our table with drink refills.  The food is great, but the cheesecake is the best!  I enjoyed our visit, and will visit again.

I really like The Cheesecake Factory chain and this location is no exception.  The menu is crazy long, so it is a great place to go with a group - anyone can find something they like.<br><br>Today I ordered the House Salad and Pizza combo from their lunch menu.  The house salad consists of greens with tomatoes and choice of dressing.  The pizza options are from the regular menu, it is just a bit smaller on the lunch menu.  I am usually a big fan of their food, but today, even though the pizza had lots of toppings, I had to eat it with a fork because the middle was soggy. :(  I&#39;m hoping this was a fluke - as I have not had this issue in the past.<br><br>Keep in mind that the meals are rather pricey, but the portions are usually enough to take home leftovers (or split a meal).

After posting my last review of the Cheesecake Factory, Ms. Kristin Hall called me personally. I would like to thank Ms. Hall for her understanding, and her excellent customer service. I would also like to thank her for keeping her word, by sending me a letter and gift card. I hope to have wonderful experience upon returning to Cheesecake Factory Perimeter.

This was the worst experience I&#39;ve ever had. My family and friends are here to celebrate my daughters birthday. We are still waiting to be seated. There have been no updates except we have to wait. We&#39;ve been here since 7:30p and we&#39;ve yet to eat. I would not recommend a family gathering here. The hostess was rude and we finally spoke with a manger to get seated and it&#39;s now 10:17p and we still have not eaten. We weren&#39;t offered any alternatives, only told we had to wait for another large party to leave.  I&#39;m waiting to see how this ends since it&#39;s so late, will the food be fresh. I don&#39;t recommend this place at all. <br><br>Also please read the response I got back.  Just a simple oh I&#39;m sorry that happened to you but , oh well.  No offer to make it right. Which is another reason I will never go back. <br>P.S.<br>When we finally got our food, some of it was cold , the bread wasn&#39;t fresh so it was tough and they were out of some of the dishes we ordered. At least one person in our party didn&#39;t get to eat at all.

I love this place and the food is always good. The cocktail drinks are awesome and on Que.<br>Yesterday, the first day of sunny and warm weather, me and my lovely decide to go find a terrace for dinner. Everywhere seemed to be packed, but we got lucky and caught a table outside at Cheesecake Factory. Everything was good except the service. Our server was distracted and border line rude. Maybe the big crowd was a factor in her behavior, lack of experience or the other extreme; being burned out from serving. <br>Ether way, I still left her 20% tip. Not sure if that was the right think to do since I do not like to reward that kind of behavior. I guess I will let the universe take care of that.

I ordered a Fresh Banana Cream Cheesecake and i got a Dulce De Leche. i called the store to see if I could get a replacement, but i was put on hold for 30 minutes and told i couldn&#39;t get a new one without receipt I never received. They told me there was nothing they could do despite my nut allergy.

This will be my last trip to the Cheesecake Factory. I&#39;m just unimpressed over all. I use to love coming here but honestly they have fallen off. The server messed up my drinks and my order and I&#39;m wondering if he was even really paying attention. He was not attentive at all. I had to flag him down instead of him coming to check on us... I&#39;m use to servers coming over and asking, &#34;how does everything look?&#34; By the time my sons food came out the right way I already finished my dinner and was ready to go. I was looking forward to celebrating an important milestone but now I knowI won&#39;t be spending anymore milestones here.

The only restaurant that has such a diverse menu. Today was a Father&#39;s Day lunch with my daughter. We reached around 1:00 PM and were able to get a place almost immediately. <br><br>The service was great the food was good. I ordered Stuffed Mushrooms and Pretzel Chicken from the &#34;Small Plate menu&#34; and both were very well executed with some very great flavor. My daughter ordered Chicken Bellagio and took half of it back home.<br><br>Overall a great experience. We skipped the Cheesecake though.

The Cheesecake Factory is among my favorite restaurants to visit.  This location proved that when I was looking for a place to eat with my friend due to other restaurants in the surrounding area closing around 9:00pm on Sunday night.  As we all know, Cheesecake Factory is known for their large selection of cheesecakes as well as their bible like menu.  The location at Perimeter Mall as well as the outdoor seating is perfect for an intimate setting.  The servers were great and made sure we had a great experience.  So far this location tops my list in Metro Atlanta.
I was just like to say Ashley is the BEST waiter ever! I always ask to be in her section when I go. Try the chicken picatta on the skinny licious menu! Also ask for Ashley ! Thank me later

It was Saturday night and we were famished, decided to call ahead to see what the wait time was for 2 hungry folks, 10-15 minutes we were told and we were sold! They held true to their word! We were seated and service was awesome! I ordered the shrimp scampi and he ordered the miso salmon. Both dishes were esquisitely delicious. Got our desserts to go, dutch apple cheesecake and Lemoncello torte. Never a disappointment! Parking can be a bit of a pain.

My son and I went here on Sunday evening around 7:00.  It wasn&#39;t crowded yet but it took way too long to get drinks.  The restaurant started to fill up.  We ordered our entrees right away and, once again, it took way too long to get our food.  We looked around and it appeared that no one else was eating either.  The waitress brought my food first because she said she didn&#39;t like the way my son&#39;s food looked.  That was nice but my food was already cold.  When they brought my son&#39;s food, I sent mine back to be warmed up.  I don&#39;t like cold pasta with shrimp.  When I finally got my food back it was warm; not as hot as I felt it should be.  Everything tasted good but it took too long to get it and it just wasn&#39;t hot enough.  Our bill was close to $100 and for that price I feel I should at least have a good experience.  This wasn&#39;t good.

The waitress, ashley w, was very rude. When we first ordered, she had a very condensing tone. After the food arrived, my friend re-asked for something that she had earlier requested in her order; our waitress walked away mid-request, said one minute,  and sat at a table chatting for 10 minutes. We had to ask another waiter to help us because she was still sitting at the table.
Food was good. Bathroom was clean. The waiter was amazing. Highly recommendable place to eat.

So I like this place but they have got to have more lunch specials. I don&#39;t want to pay $20 for a dinner size portion of a lemon chicken entree- they have other chicken dishes on the lunch specials menu but only three to pick from. And when I asked the waiter to please ask a manager or somebody if they could do a lunch size portion of this for my 15-year-old he even said no immediately and that he was not going to even ask because he already knew the answer. Well could you at least ASK? And if you can do a lunch size portion of chicken piccata how can you not do a lunch size portion of lemon chicken? I&#39;m a little bit confused on that one for sure...i just don&#39;t want to waste the food either. I guess I&#39;ll be coming here for dinner but maybe not for lunch anymore....
Not bad, I had the chicken and waffles with a fried egg and it was good. ONLY my 2nd time here but all in all not bad

We ordered take out today (Bistro shrimp pasta) and asked for the shrimp to be grilled instead of battered and we asked for broccoli and sun dried tomatoes to be added.<br>When we got home and opened the box we were sad to see that no broccoli was added, instead a few leaves of wilted arugula. When we started eating we quickly lost our appetite after discovering that most of the shrimp were not cleaned properly and some of them had a very strange color, Not burnt but more green-blue, like they were rotten. We threw everything away and now we feel grossed out :-(<br>On the upside, we also ordered the reeses cheesecake and that one is the bomb.<br>However, we will probably never order food (except dessert) from cheesecake factory again.<br>Please cheesecake factory, make your cooks more aware and responsible. These shrimp should have never made it out of the kitchen.

We dined at this Cheesecake Factory location for my niece&#39;s birthday on a Friday night. The hostess was very friendly and surprisingly  there was no wait so our party of 4  was seated immediately out on the patio.  <br>We waited for our waitress for about 15 minutes before she showed up to take our drink orders.  After our waitress  dropped the drinks off and walked away we waited for another 10 minutes for her to come back to take our food orders. I had a Strawberry Daiquiri which lacked flavor and alcohol. Everyone at my table ordered the Ceasar Salad and their Ceasar dressing was flavorless, it tasted like I was eating lettuce with heavy cream on top, the salad was a total fail. Since their portions are typically big enough to feed a family of 4 I opted to just order a appetizer.  I ordered the bang bang salmon wraps which looked delicious from the  description , I assumed bang bang meant spicy but apparently I was wrong, the Salmon was fishy and the flavors did not go well together. The other members at the table seemed ok with their selections with the exception of my one niece who did not like her entrée. Although during most of our dinner, our waitress was not very attentive, she did make every attempt to make sure my niece liked her dish by bringing out sauces and when that failed even though we didn&#39;t ask or complain she removed the Uneaten dish from our bill. To top off what started off as a horrible birthday dinner, our waitress brought out a birthday dessert for my niece because she overheard us talking about it.<br>My experience here gave me mixed feelings about the popular chain that usually provides better service. If I ever come back to this location it would only be to get Cheesecake.
Love this place, I have yet to have a bad experience. Food is always good, server was great. Wait is never longer than 15 mins.
The food was not ready and cold!!! $30 waste!! There was only three shrimps and no chicken that comes with my entree.

(Note: Since it&#39;s been a very long time since I&#39;d last dined inside this particular Cheesecake Factory, this review is specifically for the take out section.)<br><br>After enjoying our lunch at Maggiano&#39;s Little Italy on a Sunday afternoon, my sister wanted dessert, but not just any kind.  My sister was craving GOOD cheesecake, and she wanted to treat me, too!  =)  Since it was blazing hot that day, I drove the (incredibly) short distance from Maggiano&#39;s to park closer to this Cheesecake Factory.<br><br>We walked straight to the take out counter, which is on the right as soon as you enter the restaurant.  There was one customer in front of us, and since my sister and I pretty much knew what we wanted, we had made our decisions on which cheesecakes we wanted by the time the customer was done ordering.<br><br>To make a long story short, the employee taking orders at the cash register was busy taking orders over the phone and preparing take out meals.  We stood and waited at least five minutes before she finally took our cheesecake orders, and we specifically requested whipped cream to be included on the side (since I wasn&#39;t sure whether they always provided whipped cream).  After ordering and paying, we waited another ten minutes or so for our cheesecakes.  The employee was not friendly or apologetic about the delay.<br><br>When we finally got our cheesecakes, we looked at both to ensure we got the right ones and that they had whipped cream.  Neither included whipped cream, and one order was incorrect.  My sister had ordered the Ultimate Red Velvet Cake Cheesecake, but she got the Oreo one instead.  WOW.  So we requested the whipped cream again, which they put in plastic containers.  And, of course, my sister notified them of the mistake they made.<br><br>If you&#39;ve never ordered the Red Velvet cheesecake, you should know that it is a HUGE slice, so it&#39;s put in a plastic container that is larger than the standard cheesecake slice container.  The container is large enough to fit a huge salad.  However, instead of putting the large container in a plastic bag for her to carry, the employee simply handed it over to her.  Per my suggestion to request a bag, my sister got one because it would have been awkward to carry the large container, and of course there&#39;s a higher risk of dropping it on the way to my car without a bag.  <br><br>Once we got home, we didn&#39;t eat our cheesecakes right away since they were no longer cold.  We put them in the fridge for a few hours and let them chill so that we could enjoy them later.<br><br>* Chocolate Mousse Cheesecake ($6.95) - Per the menu description, this is a &#34;Silky Chocolate Cheesecake Topped with a Layer of Belgian Chocolate Mousse.&#34;  Although I&#39;m normally not a dessert person, I am a huge fan of chocolate mousse.  This cheesecake was as delicious as it sounds.  I just love the smooth texture of mousse, and it isn&#39;t overly rich like regular chocolate frosting.  You must put a bit of whipped cream on each bite!  Yuuuum...  =)<br><br>* Ultimate Red Velvet Cake Cheesecake ($7.95) - &#34;Moist layers of Red Velvet Cake and our Original Cheesecake covered with our special Cheesecake Factory cream cheese frosting.&#34;  It&#39;s HEAVENLY.  There isn&#39;t much else to say, but I really like that there isn&#39;t an overly cheesy/milky aftertaste as some red velvet cakes have.  I definitely want to get this one next time!<br><br>Overall, The Cheesecake Factory (take out section ONLY) at Perimeter Mall gets 3.5 stars because the cheesecake is amazing, but service wasn&#39;t.  The cheesecake itself easily deserves 5 stars.  So good!  I know this will sound crazy, but their Ultimate Red Velvet Cake Cheesecake is the best red velvet that I have ever tasted!  I can&#39;t believe I had never tried it until recently.  I highly recommend you try it if you haven&#39;t already!<br><br>[Review 251 of 366]
I had Cobb salad, which had tons of lettuce, but very little of the other ingredients, I could barely find the avocado, the eggs and the two little cherry tomatoes.<br>This is not a Cobb salad!

So my husband ordered some food curbside and the whole meal was freaking cold!!! The lady manager was absolutely no freaking help! Who wants to drive back up there to get food which she offered. Then she says well he paid in cash or I would&#39;ve credited him sorry! Well offer me a meal another day duh!!! I&#39;m done
Don&#39;t go save your money !!!!! No flavor ! Good servicer but food is the worst ! I just don&#39;t understand how you miss Up chicken Alfredo . Bathroom was also nasty

Me and my gf visited about 2 weeks ago--and we won&#39;t be back!  We usually visited every now and then , but we will just go to the one in Buckhead for now on. We went in to get a to -go order of Shepard&#39;s Pie and two slices of cheesecake (no issue with the cake or course). Tony (the manager)  was on the phone while we stood in front of him for at least 3-4 minutes without acknowledging us,  then hung up before even whispering anything to us ; hold on,  hand gesture signaling one moment; Nothing! .. <br><br>Fast forward to 20 mintues later when we get home . We open it up and start chowing down,  or attempting to do so.. I notice that all the insides of the meat were pink af! Disgusting!  So.. We called back to the store to inform the manager Tony (guy). He asked &#34;what do you want me to do? &#34; in a tone that didnt sit well with us. umm... Fix the issue!! <br><br>We asked for the money back and drove back to get our $$$ back.  Just for him to not come out,  he sent another manager out to speak to us.  Then he came around the corner so fast and just sat the money on the counter so quick,  didn&#39;t say anything.  Just a half a second to put it down and a half a second to walk away.  That was bullshit! No apology,  no anything.   We won&#39;t be back!! <br><br> Back to Buckhead we go; where the manager was extremely helpful to us when we had an issue before !

Sloooooooww service!!! Orders were wrong. Manager came out seemed barely phased.  I normally dine at the North Point Mall location....huge difference in service and quality.  I wont be back to this location!
outside visitor to the area. Pretty much like every other cheesecake factory. Lights dim. Food was okay. Triple chocolate cheesecake was on point. Service was great.

We went there for lunch on on 12/28/2017 &amp; I wish we didn&#39;t .<br>The Cajun jambalaya was burned , it literally tasted like a burned pan. The shrimp scampi was so oily , it looked like they put a stick of butter in the plate before they warmed it in a microwave. And last but not least, the waiter was pushing us to finish &amp; leave as quick as possible. When we ordered dessert at the end , the waiter said &#34; to go I assume&#34;. <br>We have been to different locations many times before &amp; we like it , but this visit to the Dunwoody location ( in perimeter mall) I give it a 0/10. <br><br>Merry Christmas.

The customer service at this location is the worst I have seen in any restaurant. We came in from out of town with a group of 8 and arrived to the location at 8:40pm. We talked to the hostess and she said between 30-45 minutes, our group had no problem with waiting, since it was a Saturday night that didn&#39;t seem too bad. After an hour we noticed that it had really started to clear out and we still did not have a table nor had anyone come up to us to say it was going to be longer. I went back up to the host stand and talked to a man who said he would check on our table. When he walked away he went to an EMPTY table and picked up a tray with glasses on it. He came back to the stand and didn&#39;t say anything to us to let us know it was ready just started cleaning menus and talking to coworkers. After another 10 minutes of wondering, I went back up to him and ask what he found out he then said &#34;oh right&#34; got our menus and led us to a table. <br><br>After waiting for over an hour the last thing you want is to get to the table and have an ongoing bad experience--unfortunately that&#39;s exactly what happened. Our server came over and seemed nice and ordered our drinks right away and said bread and butter would be out soon. Most of us ordered just water with the exception of 3 bar drinks, at this time one of the guys in our party ordered a slice of cheesecake. Took at least 30 minutes for the waters to come out and then another 10 for the bar drinks. Still no sign of the cheesecake OR the bread &amp; butter after those 40 minutes. When we questioned the server about the cheesecake she made an excuse on how busy they were with Togo orders even though it had quieted done immensely in the restaurant since it was now almost 11pm. We asked to speak to a manager and she asked why so we explained. She then came back 2 minutes later with the cheesecake and said she had just gone and did it herself, which we appreciated though why couldn&#39;t that have been done earlier? Bread came out next with a promise that food should be out shortly, and it did. One of the guys in our party had ordered plain angel hair pasta with just butter and told the server nothing else just butter after the server looked at him like he was crazy for ordering that. When his plate came out the server held it slanted to show him and asked if it was okay the way it was and the kitchen had made it with just a little bit of tomato on it... the entire pasta was covered in raw tomatoes. How does plain translate to tomatoes? No clue. Regardless, she took it back...at this point my fiancé finally has had enough to get up and find the manager since the server never sent him over to us after we asked. He found the manager and explained what happened from the time we came up until that point. My fiancé came and sat down as the rest of the food was coming out. The food was set in front of us quite hastily, I assume the server saw someone in our party speak to the manager. The manager came over to our whole table to ask how things were and to see if we had any appetizers, we answered with a no but one of the guys in our group got cheesecake. The manager nodded his head blowing it off and said he talked to the hosts upfront and had a &#34;teaching moment&#34; with them. He left and we all ate.
