The food was good like it usually is so no complaints there and the only reason why this gets a one star rating. The next time we saw our server she was at the table next to us chatting with them which is great but she never even tried to have a conversation with our group.<br><br>When it was time for the check to come it was a long process to even receive the check and even longer one to get the cards back. Our whole party was frustrated and tired of being at the restaurant. It was now almost midnight and someone else in our group went to find the manager because after everything that had happened we were not happy how the situations were handled. He explained to the manager that it wasn&#39;t right what had happened and how we weren&#39;t happy. The manager just said sorry and reluctantly offered to buy us a couple cheesecake slices after we had said something should be done and changed on the bill. No one was even going to order cheesecake so we left irritated that nothing was done to handle the problem. Two of the people in our party did end up getting cheesecake but they ended up paying for it so the manager ended up literally doing nothing for us. <br><br>All of these issues could have been resolved if the hosts,server and manager had communicated effectively with each other and us. I can understand a wait and something coming out wrong but what I don&#39;t understand is the lack of genuine apologetic concern. We&#39;ve all worked in the service industry so we get it. This could have been avoided or at least handled better by the supervisor. Very disappointed.

YA&#39;LLLLLLLLLLLLL... I love this place! This is my go to! I absolutely Love everything! The staff is amazing, the wait times go by super quickly. Their Louisiana Chicken Pasta is ABSOLUTELY AMAZING! The crunchiness of the chicken is perfectly mixed with the pasta and it&#39;s sauces. Oh, and lets not forget the bread. The brown bread is my favorite and this place is a staple for my friends and I.

Ordered curbside service, called the number you&#39;re supposed to call when you arrive. Dude tells me I have to come in for curbside service. Uh, no, that&#39;s not how it works. <br><br>Burger was pretty cold by the time I got home (I live 3 minutes away) and so was the bread. <br><br>Great cheesecake, but the service at this particular Factory is lacking. I won&#39;t be back.

First off I was seated and spent 15 min to get my drink and then my friends and I ordered and waited an hour and to still not get our food!!! I don&#39;t even know where our waitress was!!  This was my first time ever coming to Cheesecake Factory. I&#39;m so disappointed!!!

Just ate and was disappointed in my $7 Greek salad... Might as well be called a Cucumber,Tomato, Onion salad became that&#39;s all that was in it  Gumbo great but try harder with the salad next time please...

I was not happy with my dine in experience today. I had bad experiences in the past and wonder is that how perimeter location operate? I feel that management don&#39;t really do anything when their employees are at fault. Considering it was not busy at the time we arrived, our server was awful!  It took him awhile to get what I asked for and our drinks to replenish. The butter that goes with the bread which took him awhile to bring out, tasted awful, room temperature butter. I order the gumbo entrees, it was loaded with oil. The dish was not edible because no matter what I put in my mouth I was eating oil after oil. Granted my dessert was free but when I order my coffee and cream cheesecake, it looked so beat up. It should not looked like that considered what I paid for! Would any of the Cheesecake Factory employees and management would be happy to received a Cheesecake cake look so unprofessionally done??? I gave my server 18% tip even though he doesn&#39;t deserve it.

I feel this place is an American Classic. You can never go wrong. We got snowed in today and wanted to venture out. Was surprised to find out they were open. The Cajun Jambalaya is my all time favorite.  Moderate spicy kick.
Nice atmosphere...internal temp is perfect.<br><br>Bartender gave good pour and food is good.<br><br>What else do I want? Not much lol
I really love their menu, but today &#34;Jamal P.&#34; Provided a horrible service. He barely paid attention to us, we didn&#39;t even a smile from him. He obviously needs some additional training.

Some girlfriends and I headed here on a whem. Neither of us had been in years. We all were thoroughly impressed. Everyone ordered something different. For appetizers we had the crab dip and it was delicious. Everyone enjoyed their dishes from salads to entrees. The also have lunch options on Saturday. The cucumber martini was refreshing.

The absolute WORST. Myself and my daughter have been in bed sick for 2 days. $200 and two emails later no response. Of course they&#39;re so big they don&#39;t care. I&#39;m<br>Calling the health department and the BBB. STAY AWAY

We were sitting outside porch. <br>Server was very friendly and cheesecake was perfect! (i love vanilla bean cheesecake:P)<br><br>But one problem is!!! there was tree around and porch.<br>cockroch coming from the trees....... <br>We could see they moving so fast here to there...<br><br>I know its not cheesecake factory&#39;s fault... so I can&#39;t blame..<br>IF you are really cockroch phobia, don&#39;t sit outside lol

The wait time here is long... Don&#39;t come on a holiday or weekend if you have four or more people in your group.  A group of seven just waited 2 hours, and our group of five had been here an hour and a half already. Unfortunately, the food could be the best I&#39;ve ever tasted, but waiting this long to be seated has ruined the whole experience.  BTW... It&#39;s pricey too.

I enjoy the Cheesecake Factory! They have a variety of items to choose from that are gluten free and freshly made salads! <br><br>My one point of contention is the lighting. Our table was so dark we couldn&#39;t read the menu. <br><br>I ordered the Godiva Chocolate cheesecake and it was divine!

I&#39;ve been coming to the Cheesecake Factory almost all my life! I&#39;ve never had a bad meal here ever! The Iced Mint Green Tea is always fantastic! I love a number of entrees that I get repetitively such as the ones listed below:<br><br>Chicken Marsala<br>Chicken Lettuce Wraps<br>Chicken Madeira<br>Chicken Piccata<br>Grilled Salmon. <br><br>Believe it or not, I&#39;m not the biggest Cheesecake lover in the world but I have tried the Chocolate Cookie Dough Peanut Butter Cheesecake which was quite yummy! This is a great place to go on a date or have special occasion celebration dinner. The food, drinks, desserts, service etc. is just superb!

I always here the hype of this place for so long and finally decided to go here with my gf cause she was craving a dish there.<br><br>My first impressions, the interior was pretty nice, we got seated pretty quick,<br>our service was great, we ordered some calamari to start it off and for our mains we ordered the Chicken Marsala and Farfalle with Chicken and Roasted Garlic .<br><br>Both dishes were very good, but also very very heavy, we ended up not even finishing our dishes. For dessert i ordered some strawberry short cake and some chocolate cake for my gf, both were very good.Overall i think thought the food was actually pretty good, but just too heavy for me, i actually like to finish all my food and enjoy my dinner. Maybe next time i&#39;ll try ordering something else. But for those who haven&#39;t been here, id say it good to try it once if you havent, i&#39;d prolly go back there sometime but maybe not anytime soon. I ended up spending about 70dollars total for dinner but didn&#39;t really seem satisfied. Different strokes for different folks tho. The food wasn&#39;t bad at all, i just enjoy eating alot more variety of food that is alot more lighter.
I love the cheesecake but the food is blah. We only go for the cheesecake and if you&#39;re picking up on this location on the weekend, be prepared to wait. It&#39;s going to be slow.

I love coming to this one because the servers are all so nice, always recommending great food and personable. The food is always very tasty and filling. They have such a wide variety of food. I do have a huge issue with one hostess (brown hair and heart shaped ring) who was nothing but rude and condensing. Terrible hostess.

Had a great time here! The food was delicious, the server was friendly and personably, we were seated immediately, our food came out quickly and the server grabbed some pals and sang me happy birthday! You can&#39;t really go wrong at Cheesecake Factory, there has got to be something on the menu for everyone!

Walked in to cocktail service and had to get our own menus.   Flagged down a waiter after 15 min of no acknowledgement.  The waiter rudely said that we weren&#39;t his and gave a nasty look.  Asked to see if he could help and find our waiter.  10 minutes and still nothing.  Flagged down a server assist for some bread.  Got bread and butter and waited to find another person for a knife for butter and plates, napkins. Asked for manager at the host stand.  Manager came over.  Wines delivered with wrong sizes and sodas and waters never delivered.  Food eventually came and one of the entrees was completely wrong. By the time food arrived everyone else was done.  Ordered dessert....checks delivered before desserts and every check was wrong and wrong wine pour was still on the check.  At this point I have written this while still waiting on a dessert and new checks.  Our table is still covered in dishes, menu, bread, empty glasses.  We got here at 7:30.... it&#39;s 9:19pm.  Please send help!!!

Best time to come in is before 6pm to avoid the dinner rush. I had the Louisiana Cajun Pasta which was good. Dinner for four came to $140 before tip, including dessert. I have always had great service at this location and the portions, as you know, are HUGE. Yes it is a chain restaurant but the service at each location makes a difference and distinguishes each one.

What can I say every factory I go to I have a great experience this location no exception service food all great only thing that happy hour needs to be little longer other than that keep doing what you do making great food
Must try the Salted Caramel Cheesecake! It has a blondie brownie base with a thick layer of salty-sweet caramel on top. Magnificent!

This is a very nice place to eat. They don&#39;t jest give you small portions of food, you get a lot. The waitresses are very good at what they do. I spent $120 here and it was well worth it. That was four people eating. Had a great time and will return.

Service was incredibly slow today, you can maybe chalk it up to the holidays but I&#39;m pretty certain this is probably pretty normal. 10 minute wait for someone to come bus the table, another 10 for the server to show up, about 25 minutes for the food to come out. Food was kind of lackluster and bland. Normally when you think of Cheesecake Factory you think gargantuan portions. Not the case today. <br><br>Overall our server was not attentive, she was too busy talking with another employee.<br><br>The only reason for more than 1 star, is their cheesecake is still pretty decent. Won&#39;t dine in again at this location, if I go back to a CF it will just be for the cheesecake, to go....ordered in advance.

This has to be the worst experience I have ever had at this place, from start to finish was a joke! We arrive and in the area it is one woman next to us and we order knew exactly what we wanted and I watched the guest next to us get up go to the bar and pick up her drink that was waiting to be served to her ! We wait over 30 mins for our drinks to arrive and watched 4 people get served before us and now we have waited an hour. Finally he tells us 4 mins and sorry for the wait at this point we are ready to leave, and we ask for the food to go and just pay! The food was not what we ordered and the appetizers we ordered was cold !
This was the first time I went to a Cheesecake Factory and was pleasantly surprised. Had the Cajun jambalaya pasta and was delicious. It was close to the hotel -Le Meridien, so well worth.

Went down hill used to be good hamburger was so dry and fish had no taste slaw had no dressing told manager didn&#39;t seem to care we eat out a lot never again at this location dirty  silverware dirty tsble

Dining in the restaurant now. Just left the restroom,  guess what I felt like I am dining in a super cheap corner restaurant. It smells horrible and it is so dirty. Seriously Cheesecake Factory??? Where is your hygiene ??? I can&#39;t complain about food and service but when it comes to restrooms in the restaurant it is a very good sign how clean the kitchen might be.

There was a long line when we got here, but we only waited for less than ten minutes to get our seats. One thing I never understand at this Cheesecake Factory is that they call my buzzer and let me wait for another 10 minutes every time. Anyway, our waiter seated us. At first his service was pretty decent, he took our order very carefully, even kneed down to the floor because he couldn&#39;t hear us very well. We ordered bufflo chicken meatball and decided to share Louisiana chicken pasta since we decided to save up our appetite for some cheesecake! He offered us water as we wanted pretty fast and then VANISHED. And things went down from this point. Nobody brouht us any bread or butter, we just sat for our meals with an empty stomach for over 20 minutes since the restaurant was packed. Here comes the worst part, our meal came out before our appetizer! How ridiculous was this! My boyfriend and I were so starving that we even didn&#39;t care about this &#34;accident&#34;. The waiter who  brought our entree ( not our waiter) heard about our meatball didn&#39;t come, he asked us whether wanted to wait for it first, we just too eager to eat and  let it go. When we almost half done with our meal, the appetizer came out,  as I imagined, it was cold. I don&#39;t know how long it was seated under the heat lamp but it was definitely not fresh. I was pretty irritated by what happened there, but to this moment, our waiter even didn&#39;t show up once to check on us or refill up our water. I just finished our meal really quickly and decided to leave ASAP. Right before we finished our pasta he showed up with the dessert menu, I just ignored him and asked for the bill. I left without having the piece of cheesecake I was craving for, that&#39;s how pissed I was. After all, the service was HORRIBLE.

I was a customer at the Perimeter Mall location In Dunwoody Georgia last night. I ordered my food @6:30-6:45 as I sat at the bar. The bartender placed my order &amp; brought my beverage. I ordered simple apps: fried cauliflower &amp; chicken quesadillas. The fried cauliflower came out 7:55 they were soggy &amp; not good. I asked about my quesadillas I was told they would be out shortly. I asked if Management was available I was told he was too busy, I was meeting someone @ 9:30 nearby so I asked the bartender to remove quesadillas and cash me out it was about 9:10 when I left and had not gotten anything not an apology, no food nor the dessert that I came in for. I frequent Cheesecake Factory Cumberland often and have NEVER received such bad service. I feel my time is very valuable and I wasted over 2 hours at a restaurant where I didn&#39;t get any food. I called today &amp; spoke with the manager Christy, she apologized and said she didn&#39;t work that shift last night. So I asked for the GM or DM and she told me she wasn&#39;t allowed to give out that information and referred me to call the corporate office tomorrow. This is the most ridiculous &amp; irresponsible way of handling a paying customer. I have never had to complain about my experience at Cheesecake Factory but if this is how you handle your guest I don&#39;t think I want to spend my money here. I will be also posting my experience on yelp as well.

Wouldn&#39;t go again . The wait was ok the hostess at the front was dry. The waitress Ashley was the highlight she was very personable and attentive. However her trainee needs more work . The manager was called to our table of five early on due to the hostess and was very loud and unprofessional when he came and had this annoying fake laugh. I didn&#39;t like my pasta but was aware that I had ate too much so my request was to just remove my plate. The trainee went and bagged my unwanted plate and brought it back to me and sent the loud manager to the table that I never requested . The manager insinuated that I wanted a refund and it was clearly explained to him that I never requested him and did not want the food period. Overall Ashley and my paradise punch saved the day.

Didn&#39;t start off great when a 45 min wait turned into hour and 15 min, drink orders were mangled badly and two of the meals weren&#39;t even up to sub par with not a bit of seasons for two out of the four of us.<br>By end of the meal and desert regretted choosing this location and atmosphere was a bit upended tonight.  For a party of four spending $200 you expect a lot better and this was sub-par where a Denny&#39;s or Diner would have been better.<br>They definitely need better training for waitstaff and chefs need to be tasting what they serve.

The atmosphere is pretty hip. Most of the people that come here are in their 20 somethings. Since Perimeter Mall caters a bit towards the upper end, it is not surprising to see that kind of crowd in this restaurant. The food is good but can be towards the pricey side if you want to step out of the burger and fries venue. Our waitress was kinda slow that day and when my friend and I told her that it was our other friend&#39;s b-day, when it was time for them to sing for him, the waitress acted like it was all her idea ...<br>** (just kinda felt weird for me when the waitress was like &#34;see there u didnt think I didnt know your birthday huh? See, this is why I got everybody singing for you cuz I knew it was your bday!&#34;-- I mean we know u r working hard for that tip but damn girl! I almost wanted to ask her &#34;well since YOU know all this and YOU set all this up for his bday, YOU gonna pay too? lol.) <br><br>Other than that, it was all good. The decor is this creamy gold and dark brown that sits well with the whole &#34;cheesecake factory&#34; idea.

Visited Perimeter Cheesecake the other day and the waiter got my order incorrect. I ordered the herb crusted salmon and received the grilled salmon (that has grill lines). In the attempt to correct the problem, the manager returns with herbs heated on top of the grilled salmon which was totally incorrect. Herb crusted salmon is not grilled! As to not cause any additional problems like someone tampering with my food by a second refusal, I accepted it unwillingly and picked over it. This was poor customer service in the attempt to disguise what was already an error and pass it off again!

I am usually incredibly pleased with the Cheesecake Factory. However, this visit was the worst. From dirty floors to poor service to cheesecake that looked nibbled on. I will stick with the Mall of Georgia location. Never again will I come to the perimeter location.

This isn&#39;t one of my top choices to visit this particular location in the Metro area, but I was with my cousin celebrating her birthday. We walked in, and was acknowledged and seated quickly. Our server was attentive, and and friendly (and easy on the eyes lol). I wasn&#39;t really hungry being that I had just left the mall, and screwed up my appetite there, so I opted for a small appetizer. <br><br>I chose the loaded baked potato tots. It was labeled as a baked tot filled with cheese, bacon, and green onions served with sour cream. Sounds promising, so I&#39;m amped about trying it. When they reached the table, it looked like a freakin hush puppy. So, I&#39;m like what in the bleu cheese hell, and decided to go for it anyway. Ughhhh, so disappointed. It was filled with something like fondue cheese, and I never tasted bacon. The green onions were sparsely thrown on top of the sour cream. <br><br>The only thing that saved this rating was the cheesecake (Adam&#39;s), and the cute server. Other than that...it was a fail.

Cheesecake good waitstaff no....this place is full my daughter and I are standing close..but instead of going around..they go thru not one of them but like 4.. with no excuse me except for one of the hostesses...nichole....she said excuse me and waited then walked thru....2 stars for rudeness
We really enjoyed our visit to the Cheesecake Factory. Great food and excellent service! <br>The egg roll sampler is delicious!

Zero customer service, looks like this place run with out manager. Normally I don&#39;t like to write bad review... This passed weekend we had a very bad experience at this location we are waiting so long for our server came to take our orders... He seems looks like he&#39;s not ready for work <br> To come back on the business all staff including the manager needs more customer services training.

This Cheesecake Factory is very similar to their other Atlanta locations: decent drinks, good menu, and delicious cakes.<br><br>I just took my date to this location tonight, so my review will be based off my isolated-experience: this restaurant was good, and does deserve my 4-star review.<br><br>The main reason I took &#34;one star off&#34; is, like my fellow consumers, the Cheesecake reservation system sucks (in my opinion). Granted, this location is next to Perimeter Mall, and the restaurant is always overwhelm with customers (so I don&#39;t blame them for not implementing a tradition &#34;Call-ahead reservation system&#34;.<br><br>Thus, I will leave my review with a question to the Cheesecake Factory management: At peak customer-traffic time, is there any way that you can improve the crowded-ness of your Customer Waiting Line? Just tonight, I had to pass 20+ people just to get to your hostess...<br>(just my two-cents)

Flavor-wise, I think this is one of the worst locations I&#39;ve visited. The service I can&#39;t really comment about, it&#39;s just mediocre and nothing special. The food though! I genuinely enjoy a lot of the dishes at most Cheesecake Factory locations. This one was a stickler--absolutely everything was bad! My carbonara had barely any cream, had no taste, had maybe 7-8 pieces of tiny bacon thrown in. My friend ordered the angel hair shrimp pasta and oh my gosh, that was the worst thing ever! The noodles were no where near al dente and basically melted in my mouth, and that&#39;s not a good thing. The noodles just broke apart because they were so over cooked. Plus, the portion was oddly small for a Cheesecake Factory plate. We also ordered an appetizer, the fried tods. Supposedly this was supposed to have pieces of bacon! Nope! All I could taste was flavorless mush. An odd texture and lackluster taste. The highlight of our meal was probably the bread service. That was yummy with the butter... but honestly, quite disappointed and will not be coming back.

Excellent food and awesome cheesecakes! I&#39;m really picky with cheesecakes and to be honest, I thought mine was the best but I tries the Mango Key Lime yesterday and it was yummie! If you go there for lunch or dinner and want to eat the cake as a dessert you should just order a side dish or an appetizer for the main course, because the sizes are a gigantic! Love it! Thumbs up!

I use to love this loocation better than all of the other locations but not anymore. I dined their just yesterday and I came in at 10:15pm on a date. The server we had rushed the entire time. Saying things like can you hurry because the kitchen is about to close and that the kitchen is yelling at her to get our food order. I asked her for a recommendation and said well I&#39;m vegan. Then I asked her what&#39;s popular and she didn&#39;t even reply. My date didn&#39;t order anything becauee of it. I ended up ordering the orange chicken which was Cleary rushed as well because the rice tasted undercooked. When I asked the server for more Brown bread she said I don&#39;t know because the kitchen is really closed.

I absolutely love this place. Particularly the location. I&#39;ve been to the Northpoint Cheesecake Factory and the service is a hit or miss there...fortunately, I can say it&#39;s a steady flow of amazing-ness service at the Perimeter location =]<br><br>Yes it&#39;s a chain restaurant. Yes it is commercialized. But you know what? What business isn&#39;t? I also understand the menu is freaking HUGE but I kinda like that...I can go for a sandwich, salad, pasta, pizza, burger, steak, soup, blah blah blah. They even have orange chicken. I mean, if you want a crowd pleaser I&#39;d recommend going here.<br><br>I love the cobb salad. With bits of bacon, diced up eggs, avocado slices, chunks of chicken (to be honest, I can do without that but I&#39;ll take what I can get), blue cheese crumbles....ahhh. Thinking about it is making my mouth water all over again. *drool*<br> <br>The seared tuna salad is delicious too. Unlike the other salad entrees that come in ridiculously huge portions, the portion size for this particular salad is kinda small. But it&#39;s perfectly seared, with a peppery crust and a nice rare center. Mmmmmm.<br><br>Another dish I adore? HIBACHI STEAK!!!! Ahhhhh! For all you sweet-savory-salty people out there...this is an ABSOLUTE must. The steak is extremely tender and the mashed potatoes gives you the pleasant surprise of the occasional chunk of unmashed potato in it. Some people don&#39;t like that but...I dig it.<br><br>Mango smoothie with a dash of raspberry puree gets me everytime. If you can&#39;t afford their pricey cocktails (like me) bring your own flask and spike it...yes I&#39;ve done that before. Bite me.<br><br>Lastly...I should probably mention I&#39;m a huge bread kind of girl. I like their bread here---comes with complimentary mini loaves of the oat-wheat-brown bread and the sour dough. I&#39;m a fan. Ask for the blue cheese dressing (it has chunks of blue cheese in it) on the side and the tabasco sauce...hellloooo dipping sauce! Fo fwee! Win!<br><br>I&#39;ve tried their cheesecakes before and nothing really pops out to me. I&#39;m not really a &#34;cheesecake&#34; type of gal though...pass. Tiramisu is pretty hands down AWESOME. Although they can lighten up on all that whip cream....<br><br>Parking is easy shmeazy. It&#39;s not valet but you DO have the option of doing that if you&#39;d like to fork out that extra $4-$6.

The food was great and drinks too But the service was atrocious. <br>Note to the management: if you have trainees on Tuesdays night, charge like 50% less, otherwise it is a expensive cruel joke what you do to your customers. Spent $150 , but I could do better as a waiter, even I never tried.

Staff was really really rude.. we were 6 people together and we told them at the time of check in.. after 45 mnts we got a table and server comes and said this table is only for 4 people and you ll have to wait another half an hour. Did not even apologize :(((((((

My boyfriend and I go here alk the time. It is probably my favorite restaurant to go to because of the variety of food to pick from. They always have a fast service when you are seated inside but I think sitting outside is a different story. When outside everything seems a lot slower. The only time we have sat outside is the only bad experience we ever had there. The waiter would make very rude comments and got very impatient with my boyfriend and I. She did not get our order right and came back 2 times to ask us questions about the order. But this one experience will not over ride all the good ones!! Try the Godiva Chocolate Cheesecake!! It&#39;s my favorite!! And the mushroom appetizer is so amazingly yummy!!

Our waitress was the ABSOLUTE WORSE!!!! Food was just &#34;ok.&#34; Not worth the time or the money! Only thing I would say was half way decent was the cheesecake...however it left an after taste...not worth it if you ask me.

This was the WORST dining experience ever! We waited half an hour to be seated for a &#34;15&#34; minute wait and about 2 hours for food I could have driven to Florida by the time our food was ready would recommend to someone you hate

I come here all of the time for their happy hour specials Monday through Friday from 4 p.m-6p.m at the bar, and the tables near the bar. Cheesecake factory has the best hands down appetizers.  I love their corn tamales, chicken buffalo. Yummy.  The drinks are ok. Feels a little water down to me.  The bartender are sweet.  Totally recommend this restaurant to everyone.

I came here with 12 lovely friends including the birthday girl for a lovely birthday brunch last weekend. I&#39;m pretty sure it&#39;s been about 7 years or more since I last stepped into a Cheesecake Factory so this was quite the exiting visit and occasion.   I forgot how much I like the Cheesecake Factory and was so impressed with the service and food that I might just go back for future visits.  The menu hasn&#39;t changed much but they did have a &#34;Skinnylicious&#34; menu for the calorie counters or if you&#39;re craving something low-cal.  I actually ordered off that menu during my last visit because I was craving a salad and was fully satisfied with their Mexican Chicken tortilla salad.  Everyone at our table enjoyed their brunch/lunch menu and our sever, Caroline was AMAZING. She handled all of our requests promptly and with a smile.  I really appreciated that even on a busy Sunday morning, she was super attentive and made sure that everyone&#39;s glass was half full at all times.  Even when it came time to paying our bills, she was accurate and efficient.  Their cheesecake menu still rocks and although I didn&#39;t get a slice during my last visit, my friend Jessica Y. and several others ordered their desired slices and the portion size looked perfect.  Looking forward to visiting them, possibly just for the cheesecake, next time!

This past Saturday, I dined at the Cheescake Factory at Permieter Mall with my family and unfortunately, it was not a good experience. Our server was great but my meal, the &#34;Herb Crusted Salmon&#34; was not what I expected.  It was neither hot nor fresh; and when I sent it back, the manager brought the food out within a matter of minutes.  I asked how it was possible for the food to be ready so fast and if this was fresh.  She said yes but after I looked at my plate, I could tell that it was the same piece of salmon because the corner that I bitten off of was missing.  When I questioned her about it not being fresh, she stated that it was not against company policy for them to reheat food.  I was appalled because I am very well aware of the dangers associated with <br>improperly reheating foods and the potential illness it can cause.<br><br>I said ok, asked for my check, and left the restaurant.  I&#39;m certain that I will never return.  When I walk into any establishment spending my money, I expect to be treated with the upmost respect for my time and for my money.

The service at this place is terrible! I just wanted to place an order to go and I was waiting on hold for over 20 minutes and still no answer. I hanged up and called again and they didn&#39;t even apologize but instead put me back on hold. TERRIBLE

If you&#39;re  really hungry and you chose Cheesecake  Factory, then you pick the right place!!!  I&#39;ve  been here many times and the food is always good.  The menu is a little  overwhelming, but when you&#39;re  undecided or with a group that&#39;s  undecided about what to eat, then they offer a wide variety  of things to eat.  I chose the Teriyaki  chicken  and it was delicious,  can&#39;t  go wrong with that choice.<br><br>I would&#39;ve  given it 5 stars, but the floor is sooo slippery from grease, it kind of turned me off.  That&#39;s a &#39;slip and fall&#39; waiting to happen!!  There needs to be a solution because one, it&#39;s  gross and two, it&#39;s dangerous.  Please, put down a runner or something fancy or constantly  clean the floors, because it&#39;s  not a good look for a great restaurant  such as this  one.
The food was good as usual. The ambiance is great. The dessert and strawberry lemonade is to die for. It&#39;s a great place for large groups and children.

Unfortunately this Cheesecake Factory does not live up to the expectations set with previous dining experiences.  The meal was at best called disorganized with no one approaching our table for drinks for almost 15 minutes.   Our drinks arrived 10 minutes after being ordered closely followed by our appetizer which was served at the same time as our entree and our bread (white bread was almost cold and the pumpernickel was piping hot, not a nice contrast).  <br>The only redeeming quality was our food.  We got a the buffalo chicken blasts and while they tasted delicious only about 1/3 of each bite had filling while the other half was pure fried wrapper.  It was a bit too much for us even though we enjoyed the flavor of what we did eat.  <br>We split the chicken coseletta  which was prepared perfectly, but unfortunately the sauce had absolutely zero flavor.  We enjoyed the dish overall, but just wish the sauce had some flavor.  The mash potatoes and asparagus were both excellent! <br>Overall we enjoyed what we ate, but the experience was definitely lacking.

Although I hate crowded restaurants, especially at a franchise such as The Cheesecake Factory. I like this specific location. It tends be very busy during the weekends. I have been here for lunch several times during the weekday and it&#39;s not as noisy, which is relaxing when you can actually hear the music. <br><br>I have been here numerous amount of times over the year. I remember celebrating a birthday dinner here about 4-5 years ago and at the time, they accommodated my large party with reservations prior to the event. I don&#39;t think they do it anymore based on some recent reviews I&#39;ve read. <br><br>FOOD/DESSERT: Pretty good food and portion for the price. I love their calamari and tex-mex egg rolls appetizer. For entrees, they have an extensive menu ranging from items such as pasta to burgers to salads. They also have a SKINNYLICIOUS menu for folks watching their calories. That&#39;s always a cool thing.  Cheesecake is pretty good as well as their cakes. I tend to get the fruity cheesecakes such as the Mango Key Lime (comes with macaroon crust, which is coconutty) or chocolate-based cheesecakes. <br><br>SERVICE: On point all the times I have visited.

Came in on a Sunday, thinking We were beating the crowd at 5:30pm. After being sat, we were greeted quickly but the remainder of the service fell short of expectations. Took about 20 minutes to have our appetizers brought out but we were missing the kids item placed with the appetizers. We ordered fries thinking it would be a pretty easy order but turned out to a 30-35 minutes wait while our kid slowly suffered from hangriness.Still patiently waiting another 15...so about a 45 minutes wait for entrees and still no signs of the food. So you can imagine at the one hour mark at a restaurant pushing this many table turn overs, you&#39;re wondering if it&#39;s the kitchen or service?! Needless to say only come in if you&#39;re expecting to wait your entire evening for cold dried up food you would expect pipping hot. By the time we actually got to leave with no entrees in our bellies because I asked for the food to be boxed up, we were about 1.5-2 hours deep into WAITING. Not sure what was better, the cold terrible food OR waitress&#39;s inability to even smile. DO NOT GO TO THIS CHEESECAKE factory.

Cheesecake Factory has been our go to place whenever we have come in to Atlanta on Sundays for meetings the coming week. This time there was a slight disappointment that many things were not working.  Ran out of Stella draught beer,  no milk for a cappuccino and our cheesecake salted caramel was not available. According to the manager it had been a very busy weekend and supply couldn&#39;t meet up with demand. Overall our food was good, miso salmon was excellent and so was the pork chop and the fish and chips. When I got the bill I was disappointed to see that the percentage tip recommendation is based on the after tax amount, that seems like trying to trick customers to pay a higher tip.

Have you tried brunch here?!?  Good stuff, and the prices aren&#39;t bad at all!  You can actually find brunch items for as low as $8 to $9.  Service is usually good here.  Prepare for a crowd and possible wait, depending on what time you arrive.  I would say between 10am and 11am for less, after 12pm for more!  The French Toast here is definitely on point!  <br><br>If you&#39;re a Reese&#39;s fan, definitely try the Peanut Butter / Chocolate Cheesecake.
Good food, only complaint is that their phone NEVERS works. They may answer, but every time I call them they can never hear what I say and its not my phone. Hope they can resolve this issue.

He gave me a big surprise, in the style made me feel the chef&#39;s intentions; in taste, really fresh and delicious! Worth everyone to enjoy! Attitude is also very good, the restaurant environment is impeccable! I like this place！！

I love Cheesecake Factory. The food is always fresh and delicious. However at this particular location (in Perimeter) I faced unacceptable things that made me leave right after the server brought menus.<br>Our silverware was dirty - small pieces of dried food stuck to knives and forks. Spoons were covered with water spots.<br>The floor was so greasy that anyone could practice ice-skating right there.<br>Please make the place SAFE and CLEAN. 3 stars until that for good service and tasty food.

Cheesecake Factory at Perimeter Mall has always been my favorite restaurant. I usually have a great experience however that was not the case this time. I met a friend there for dinner. We told our server that the checks would be separate. She accidentally swapped our checks. We explained the error to her. She attempted to fix it but did not so we ended up paying for each others meal. We then explained the situation to a manager she said she would take care of the issue by correcting the charge. A few days later I saw I was still billed incorrectly. I called Cheesecake, asked to speak to a manager only to nonchalantly be told that I could be it refunded the difference as he rushed me off the phone. After this disappointing experience I am now looking for a new favorite restaurant.

I know a lot of people like Cheesecake Factory.<br>Their menu is extensive and a great selection. It is not a place I would choose to have a tasty meal. Of course, their cheesecakes are out of this world.

We&#39;re go about 2-3 times a month. Usually will sit near the bar. High top tables are first come first serve. Staff are usually solid, personable and typically no complaints. <br><br>When we do order to go frequently.... always ready in under 20 minutes. I am a major fan of their veggie burger. Of course the vanilla bean cheesecake is always a hit. The portion sizes are typically on point. We do always check our carry out because once every few visits they mess up on order or skimp on the portion size. <br><br>Enjoy their bartenders and staff. Super friendly and drinks are good. Happy hours are from 4 pm - 6 pm, and worth it. Lol

I was at this location yesterday 8/25/18. The cheesecake factory at Lenox had a hour to 45 minute wait so we went to the ashford-funwoody location because there was no wait time. Now i know why!  The wait staff was horrible the person was constantly rolling her eyes everytime she came to our table to deliver our foid. As a matter of fact she went to the wrong table evrrytime she delivered food. I over heard here asking about the order and i recognized it was my food and directed her to my table. These restaurants have got to hire QUALITY, QUALIFIED, workers. The food was COLD, NASTY and took forever to come maybe thats why it was cold. There were also NATS flying around snd you had to swat them away constantly.  S

There was no wait time! My drinks came right away and so did my food! I&#39;ve been to other Cheesecake Factory when I go out of town (they sooooo need one in Charleston SC!) and I&#39;ve never gotten service this quickly! Thanks guys! Obviously you took the time to improve your services after others bad experience and that says a lot!!!
This place is too busy and IMO not worth the wait.<br>We came early.. say 6 pm and had to wait a darn hour.<br><br>No way I am coming back to stand in line for mediocre and salty food

This was my 2nd time here, and the food quality was poor, and the service is definitely suck, and accidentally left my wallet there and went back to pick it up on the day after, and all my cash was missing, they say they gonna ask and call me back, which I have no faith on them! And like I say till now they haven&#39;t even get in touch with me.

This Cheesecake is ok. Been here sometimes and it&#39;s great others not so much. <br><br>Usually can&#39;t go wrong with the burger though, and the bartenders are always cool so the wifey and I typically eat at the bar.

As soon I walked in the front desk attendants had a horrible attitude. None of them smiled or even looked up when talking to me. The only thing that saved this visit was the server I had. He was beyond friendly and had great customer service. Maybe, they should take notes of his attitude and apply it to the first thing people have to go too. The food was nothing special that&#39;s why I rate this at a 3. Would have been a 2 star but the server saved it. I highly suggest the owner or manager take the time to train his front desk in customer service..!!
I&#39;ve been here several times and it is always crowded for a good reason. Food is great and service for the most part is ok.

We went there tonight October 11th 2016.  I ordered the chicken burrito.   I asked if they could substitute beef for the chicken!  She said sure!  I got the bill and they charged me $4.95 for the beef!  Lol!  Well that&#39;s the last time I go there!  I did not finish it!  It was loaded with rice and very little beef!  Their loss!

Dinner was Ok. I was disappointed in a few items. There were 7 of us. Also my 7 year old daughter ordered cheese pizza and the waitress rung up and brought her a full size/full price which I was VERY unhappy with. I had skinilicous lemon crusted shrimp and the shrimp was over cooked there was not enough sauce on the pasta and the green beans were barely cooked (way less than aldente) our waitress was decent but very behind. We constantly had to ask for refills and really did not feel waited on. It was an Ok meal but for $160 I was super disappointed and will not return.

I placed a delivery order (thru DoorDash) for a very large group today. Not only was the entire order perfect (which is rare for our group), but EVERYONE loved their dishes. It&#39;s hard to impress large groups. There&#39;s always at least one issue or complaint. I had to leave a review to say thank you for such excellent food and service!

4 stars only because there are limited places to sit while you wait for your table and there is always a wait. <br><br>Food is consistently good and I never run out of new things to try! Went on half price cheesecake day and I am still dreaming about the Pineapple Upside Down cheesecake, I always get that one lol!

On Monday, 11/07/16 we went in for lunch and it was VERY good..... Then our server Teresa got our bill wrong 2 times....76.00.....53.00 (which was less than what we owed so we honestly let her know to add our desert to the bill) and finally 62.00 (the correct amount). We were told that the incorrect amounts would be credited back to the account in 24hrs.....By Wednesday the 53.00 had dropped of but not the first charge of 76.00. The manager Tony asked that we speak with someone in the office by the name of Amber but we were also told to contact our bank. Needless to say the customer should not have to do the leg work to correct the employees mistake. Hopefully everything will be settled by the end of the week.. It&#39;s just inconvenient to have your money tied up like that.

This is probably the first time I&#39;ve been to a Cheesecake Factory in maybe 8-9 years... okay maybe longer. All I had remembered the menu is HUGE and the cheesecake is tasty. <br><br>We were going to get Mexican, but it was 5pm and the height of rush hour.. we sat for 15-20 minutes and didn&#39;t even get barely a mile. We were both in the &#34;I&#39;m too hungry to talk to you, be nice to you, or not scream in traffic&#34; kind of mood, so we pulled into the mall, thinking we&#39;d just walk around and get something from the cafeteria.. and then we walked towards Cheesecake Factory, because of where we parked, and we decided to give it a go.<br><br>We were sat pretty quickly. I noticed it was in the middle of happy hour and waited a few minutes for drinks and bread. One lady walked by and dropped off some bread, some rye? pumpernickel? with oats?  I don&#39;t know, but it&#39;s good.  I think it&#39;s the same as O-u-t-b-a-c-k bread actually.<br><br>AN-Y-way, We ordered about 10 minutes in.. we finished our bread and almost our drinks..  and before I knew it, we had been sitting there for over 40 minutes and still no food, no bread refill. The table that showed up after us, was getting their food. I was sure they didn&#39;t order before us.. I was about to get angry, when our food was placed in front of us.<br><br>He got a turkey avocado sandwich, which he inhaled, with sweet potato fries.. which we brought home. I ordered the Chicken Bellagio, which besides sounding like a fancy-as-$#@! name, is delicious. Crispy baked chicken on top of basil pasta with a bit of a buttery creamy sauce, with prosciutto and arugula and parmesan cheese on top of that.  The first bite was delicious.. and then then next and the next and the next.. and soon I realized how RICH and savory it really was, and decided to box up over half of the plate to bring home. <br><br>The waitress came back by and we asked for the check and a piece of the Adam&#39;s chocolately peanut buttery fudge ripple cheesecake to go.  We ate it later at home and it did not disappoint.<br><br>Overall, if the food sucked, this place would be a 1 or 2 star experience, because tonight&#39;s service was not impressive.  However, we both really enjoyed our meals, so there&#39;s your saving grace. After all, the actual food can have an impact on how you feel about a restaurant.. sometimes. We have a bunch of food leftover, and I&#39;m not sure if I&#39;d go back necessarily, unless someone specifically requested it, or it was the only thing open, but 3 stars for this experience. A-OK.

It&#39;s the usual case with Cheesecake Factory. This is one of the few chains where service is consistently good and the food is good. I am a person that prefers places with small menus but this place has a large menu. I try something new every time no matter where I am at and the food is always good. I ordered the meatloaf this time and my companion ordered the jambalaya. Food came out promptly and the service was attentive and no complaints. I am usually a type of guy that prefers tomatoes and ketchup on his meatloaf but the caramelized onions and gravy was quite tasty and made me reconsider my meatloaf choices so far in life.

Stopped in for a bite nice crowd fast abd friendly  service from my waiter, Matthew was very inpressed by his knowledge of the menu and honest suggestions. He convinced me to try the dulce leche cheese cake so i grabbed a slice to go. I would definitely come here again when in town

They just ran out of spinach dip. That&#39;s what I came here for. And they ran our of spinach dip. WTF! Not the ingredients to make the dip. But everything that goes in the dip. <br><br>We are here with a large party and they waiter seems to be overwhelmed. Forgetting drinks and orders. Not too great. I do not know if he is new....but that is no excuse. And the chick helping him is clearly coming across that she doesn&#39;t want to be here. <br><br>Although the waiter took our order it still took him 20 minutes and three times of tell us he will be putting the order in before he actually did!!!<br><br>Oh well. I shall get my cheesecake and go home....

I love cheesecake in Dunwoody. The management there is the absolute best. All the employees are knowledgeable and the food is Excellent. I would definitely recommend this establish. I am a frequent diner here.

The food was just okay. There was nothing special about it. I ordered the fried shrimp with broccoli and mashed potatoes. I didn&#39;t even bother taking the mashed potatoes with me. They absolutely had no flavor. The server was horrible. We sat at one of the smaller tables and he never once removed any item once we were finished with it. We literally had a table full of stacked plates in front of us. I will say that the JW Pink Lemonade was awesome.
Good customer service and delicious food. <br>Try crab meat with artichoke. <br>Huge portions.
Last night waited almost an hour for a take out. No one apologized or even checked on us. People were not friendly and wish we went somewhere else. Food was fine.
We had to order a meal to go. It was sooo yummy.<br><br>Artichoke, grilled asparagus thing and finally steak medallions. A+

I would not have expected to give The Cheesecake Factory such a high rating, but their lemoncello cream torte is worthy of 5 stars. Absolutely delectable layers of vanilla cake and lemon mascarpone cream are topped with streusel and served with strawberries, syrup, and whipped cream, and I think I tasted lady fingers as well. The cake is so moist and soaks up the strawberry syrup, strawberry juice, and lemon mascarpone. You can see the photo I posted. The mixture of the strawberry and lemon made it taste like passion fruit. I am not a fan of their cheesecake; I find it too soft and lacking in taste, and it just doesn&#39;t have the right texture - I am quite smug about the cheesecake I bake (my secret recipe), although ordering cheesecake is fun here because of all the choices. The rest of the menu is just okay; this is a chain. I was recently in Austria and Germany and was terribly disappointed by the desserts there, even in Vienna&#39;s famous cafes. The lemoncello here is superior to what I had there, and they got the streusel just right; the mascarpone is uniquely done!

Very poor customer service...I called to place a to go order and was asked to hold for one moment, the female Lola never came back to the phone and after 12 minutes of holding a male picked up and stated that he just seen the line holding and asked to help, I told him I had been on hold a long time and only wanted to place a order, he stated he would transfer me to the bakery and they would assist me , I was transfer and left on hold almost another 20 mins before some one answered and finally took my order.

Food was not hot. Called in the order and the wait was beyond 30 minutes when the estimated time was 20 minutes.  The order was incorrect and the customer service was ridiculous. Disorganized Mess!!!! Definitely not the quality I&#39;m use to receiving at Cheesecake Factory.

Service was AWFUL. We found ourselves looking around for our server several times during our meal. My salad was served without dressing and my sandwich came without the dip. I had to ask for both. Food was good, but worst restaurant service I&#39;ve had all year. No plans to return! I even spoke with the manager - he apologized and thanked me for the feedback - somewhat halfheartedly, asked where I was seated and that was it. I have no plans on returning.

Waited 45 minutes for horrible food and customer service. I ordered the  burrito, which should be blackened chicken ,full of grilled vegetables ,and rice and more.<br>It was hardly any chicken and vegetables in there. It was plenty of rice in there and that was It. And they changed the way they cook It now- I kept tasting something that tasted like beef- IT WAS HORRIBLE! Never again will I get that<br>My guy got the Louisiana pasta, It was hardly any sauce on it so It was very dry. Not good<br>The floor at the restaurant was so slippery everyone kept sliding. I told the Server I almost fell like three times when I got up !! i asked was somebody going to get it cleaned but no one ever came. The prices have went up extremely high and the Quality of food down!! I think I&#39;m done with Cheesecake Factory for good-not worth the money <br>Only reason I gave It a 2 was because the strawberry lemonade was so awesome! That was the best thing

Slowest service ever!!!! They were not busy &amp; tables seated after us were served much faster. The young woman didn&#39;t seem to be interested in attending to us. Had to ask for bread ( claimed) they had to make more yet the table beside us received bread &amp; it seemed readily available.  She just wasn&#39;t that into us.

I don&#39;t normally enjoy writing reviews about corporate, chain restaurants. Firstly, I believe their atmosphere and theme to be silly and derivative, and secondly, I&#39;d rather spend my money on an establishment where the money flows more directly into the community. With that said, I recently visited the Cheesecake Factory at the Perimeter Mall and it warrants a review, for reasons both good and not so good. <br><br>To begin with, the interior of the restaurant looks like something one would find at Disneyworld - this is to say somewhat cute, an obvious attempt to come across as attractive. I don&#39;t even know where to begin to describe the décor or this place - it had fake columns reminiscent of the Classical world,  carved faces in the fashion of the Aztecs and Mayans, and painted ceilings resembling poor man&#39;s imitation of Michelangelo. Weird, but not outright unattractive. <br><br>The Cheesecake Factory is always busy and doesn&#39;t take reservations on weekend nights during peak  hours. This means you will wait for 15 - 30 minutes to be seated. That&#39;s not so bad, but even though the restaurant is quite large, it&#39;s also cramped and loud making conservation quite difficult. The service is definitely friendly. I was asked, &#34;How are you tonight, sir?&#34; multiple times (which I presume to be a dictat from on high to the staff) but it&#39;s not very snappy, either. This is to be expected and forgiven in such a busy establishment, though. That said, it&#39;s not somewhere I&#39;d recommend you go out for a date night or an intimate and relaxing dinner. <br><br>The menu is very extensive, almost overwhelming. Personally, I prefer a restaurant that trims downs it menu and focuses on doing several things very well, but the Cheesecake Factory takes the opposite, broader approach.  Now, to the most important part - the food. It&#39;s nothing to write home about but I certainly didn&#39;t leave hungry, either. I had the fried macaroni balls for the appetizer - rich and filling, and chicken pot stickers for dinner. I&#39;ve certainly had better pot stickers, but they were quite good, served with a slightly crispy shell, chicken and seasoned with ginger soy sauce. I cleaned my plate and have no real complaint to deliver about the fare, but no accolades, either. <br><br>The drinks are a bit on the pricey end of normal. The house wine is $8.00 and the Lemon Drop I ordered was $10. Not outrageous, but more than what one would pay at a similar corporate chain restaurant. <br><br>Finally, the place is called Cheesecake Factory for a reason. Numerous varieties of that delicious pastry are available and if you like them as much as do I, you won&#39;t be disappointed. Personally, the Red Velvet is my favorite, but I plan on trying the numerous other varieties over time.<br><br>Finally, The Cheesecake Factory is a  restaurant that does what it does without having a unique experience and serves good, though not exceptional food. I wouldn&#39;t recommend going out of your way to eat here, but if you know what you&#39;re getting into, and want to take home a delicious cheesecake for a midnight snack, give it a shot. <br><br>Pros: CHEESECAKES. Extensive menu means that even pick eaters will be able to find something they enjoy.<br><br>Cons: Not much to offer in terms of ambiance, and while the food food is nominally good, nothing stands.<br><br>Verdict: Recommended IF someone else is paying, or a group can&#39;t decide what kind of good to eat that night.

I have to agree with most everyone on here. Service is terrible. Painfully slow even when restaurant is empty. I&#39;m guessing management just sits in the back and doesn&#39;t care what happens. Food averages 35 minutes to get no matter how basic- salad 35 minutes. Glass of tea- 35 minutes-  basket of bread 35 minutes. You get the picture? Asked to speak to a manager we left after 15 minutes and no manager.

I have been to this location several times, and while the food is always delicious (when does CCF ever put out bad food? Never!) the service is remarkably subpar. Not only is it usually slow, but I&#39;ve had a few waiters be downright inattentive to the point of rude. I have a suspicion it is because I&#39;m usually with my younger siblings (high school/early college aged) and they assume that because we&#39;re all relatively young that we don&#39;t tip well. On the contrary, my standard tip is 20%, with percentage deducted only for bad service, and all my dining companions tip the same way. We&#39;re never rowdy or rude, so I am really shocked to see that this behavior by the waiters is a pattern and not a fluke. This is the only Cheesecake Factory location I&#39;ve ever had a problem like this at.<br><br>Food: 5 stars because it&#39;s always delicious, fresh and huge portions<br><br>Service: 2 stars because I&#39;m almost always treated terribly and left to wait forever for food, drink refills and the bill<br><br>Compromise: 3 stars total

This place always is clean and the food and service are top notch.<br>The only reason why I can&#39;t give this restaurant 5 stars is because it takes a long time for the food to come out- even when the place doesn&#39;t seem that busy.

Awful. Everyone at my table was served but me. When their meals were half gone another waitress came by and asked if I ordered anything. I said that I had and she said she would check on it. Needless to say she never came back. When the meal was over and we were ready for a checks the original waitress came by and asked if I still wanted mine after I pointed it out that I never got my order. I declined, asked to speak to the manager, and she huffed that she already told him to come over. When he did come over he did apologize and asked how he could make it better. By that time I was to angry and her horrible service on top of my own personal experience. He did try to offer me my order to go at no charge, but I was to angry to even eat. Stay away, there are 3 other AMAZING places that are worth the money and time.

Horrible service. This is the second time we&#39;ve experienced bad service, except last time we were smart enough to walk out. We came in to order cheesecake to go then waited 15 minutes before I finally walked up and asked when our order would be ready. Turns out it had been sitting there the whole time while the serves were just talking to each other instead of giving out the food. It should take less than 5 minutes to cut and box cheesecake. So ridiculous. Worth the drive to go to the Lenox location.

It&#39;s a Cheesecake Factory, which means you get the consistent Cheesecake Factory experience. It&#39;s often stupid busy but the staff are nice and handle it as best as possible. The desserts are amazing (Limoncello Cream Torte is spectacular and, I suspect, under appreciated because it&#39;s not cheesecake) and the portions are stupid large. <br><br>Stuffed tots, thai lettuce wraps, guacamole, and tuscan chicken are my favorites, your mileage may vary.

If I could give no stars I would this is the worst experience I&#39;ve ever had at the Cheesecake Factory. The server was nonchalant. We ran out of drinks we had to ask him for a refill when he came back. We waited for over 30 min and ALL of our food was cold when they bought it out.

Hi there, I&#39;m dining at the Cheesecake Factory at Perimeter Mall and I have the tasty Miso Salmon and rice with a tall glass of water. I taste the water and it completely taste raw. I address my waiter about the taste and he doesn&#39;t know why that would be. I ask may speak with a manager about the issue and she says that she would have to charge me for a bottle of water, after she explained that sometimes the water does have an after taste to it. I said OK thank you. She didn&#39;t suggest any other recommendations or anything. She just walked away. I wondered where is the Customer Service. BEWARE of Cheesecake at Perimeter.  I think you should be aware of the after taste in the water and why it&#39;s there.
Food always good and consistent.  Staff always nice and friendly. Such a long wait today!  Almost an hour. Holiday week, can&#39;t blame them.

Always satisfied when we dine here.  Love the sweet wheat bread with butter to snack on until dinner arrives.  It has been about a year since I&#39;ve last dined here and the menu has changed a bit but sill offers yummy sounding dishes.  this time I got the bbq salmon topped with onion rings and served with mash potatoes and broccoli.  hubby got mac and cheese burger and sweet potato fries.  Everything was delicious.  Also got a slice of chocolate cake - huge slice with whipped cream

$5 happy hour? I&#39;m there. I was looking forward to good food, great prices and an awesome happy hour companion and thats just what I received in addition to a go with flow waiter. His name escapes me right now but I love the fact that my off the wall jokes didnt deter him and he just fit right in.<br><br>I&#39;ve been here before but not as a &#34;Yelper&#34;  ha! Now that I&#39;m doing reviews,  I&#39;ve become extra nosey, and if you know me I&#39;m super nosey, got my P.I. license at H.O.M.E. but anyway on with the reiview. <br><br>There was no wait time due to my  friend securing a great spot in the bar area. I was happily surprised they allowed an incomplete party to be seated right away. The server was funny and had a great attitude. I had the spicy chicken rolls and the avocado rolls...The avocado rolls are to die for and the chicken was just ok, not as good as the Southwest Egg rolls from Chili&#39;s but hey they tried. I had the Pink Lemonade to quench my thirst and that it did. One of the best mixed drinks I&#39;ve had in a long time. <br><br>All in all I enjoyed my visit and will partake in their Happy hour more often. I may be headed there this evening. What an awesome way to spend $20.

First time here, got the herb crusted salmon that comes with mash and asparagus. It was amazing, I&#39;m trying to inquire how to buy a huge tray of that mashed potato because I&#39;ve honestly never had such a good mashed potato experience in my life. We also got macaroni cheese balls which were okay and some buffalo chicken springroll/egg roll thing that was just okay. Cheesecake was obviously good got the carrot and some chocolate one.
Best cheesecake in town hand down. I love the asian chicken wrap here. My fries was over cook but the steak was cook to perfection.

I like Cheesecake factory but they are waaaaaaayyy overpriced.<br><br>I love the bread, cheesecake and the spicy black pepper chix is my favorite dish. The drinks over waaaaaaaay overpriced also.<br><br>Love n Hate relationship with this place.

This was my first trip to the Perimeter location, and it did not disappoint. Our server (gosh I wish I could remember her name) was terrific! There were 12 in our party, and we arrived a little before 6pm on a Sunday and were seated almost immediately. Our food was all made as ordered, delivered hot &amp; fresh, our server kept our drinks refilled... It was perfect. My boyfriend &amp; I hot our usual Stuffed Chicken Triangles, and Buffalo Blasts... Wonderful as usual. Thank you, thank you!

Best experience with a group that I have had here thus far. I came to Cheesecake in Dunwoody for my boss&#39;s farewell party with about 18 of my colleagues around 11:30am on a Tuesday. Once we arrived we noticed that the restaurant had just had a Food Safety inspection and had not received a favorable grade. We were for a lack of words mortified to see that right before our meal as we are ironically employees of the nations premier health protection agency. Nevertheless, our reservation was made and it would be difficult to navigate such a large group to another restaurant with such short notice so we decided to take a chance. We had one waitress I believe her name was Ashley or Britney and she served all of us efficiently and with courtesy. The food did not come out all together but that wasn&#39;t a big deal for us. No one had any issues with their dishes, all preferences were paid attention to. We received our drinks in a timely fashion as well as our checks. I ordered the same thing I always get the Bang Bang Chicken and Shrimp with extra veggies. It was piping hot but a little heavier on the sauce then usual. No one reported ill so all went well.

Had a date here for the new Year and it was so sweet we knew we would have a wait so it didn&#39;t bother us the host was so nice and worked with us to get a good table. Plus our server Darnel was so sweet even comping our food so that I Could get something else. No complaints really Just didnt like one of the drinks from the bar and the divinci pasta wasn&#39;t doing it for me it tasted like it had no sauce. But Darnel switched it out for another bistro shrimp pasta that was so yummy.

We ordered hamburgers and they were pretty good--but honestly not as good as we remember from previous experiences.  Unfortunately, our server was not very attentive (no refills on our drinks the whole time we were there; also, we arrived just after the restaurant opened, so it was not busy).  We were served none of the usual &#34;free bread&#34; (we saw other diners get served their free bread).  We have had better experiences at this location in the past so we were disappointed today.  The cheesecake we got (to go) after we ate was excellent, though, so it went some way to make up for the dining experience.
Mediocre service, to top it off my steak was tasteless. I would not recommend anyone to eat here if you want to have a good experience.. I will deffinently not be returning..

I am extremely upset about the quality of food at the Cheesecake Factory as it has gone down hill significantly over the years. I called ahead to order the BBQ chicken salad but with shrimp instead of  chicken because i don&#39;t eat meat. It was about 9 o&#39;clock on a Wednesday night (not a crowded time). I was told it would be ready in 15 minutes. I arrived in 25 minutes and it was not ready. In fact i don&#39;t  believe they event started making it because the girl went back to the kitchen to get it for me and she was gone for over ten minutes. This salad has 6 ingredients (besides the shrimp) and i was charged over $21 which is absurd in an of itself. But they left off one of these ingredients (the fried onions) which i did no notice until i arrived home. Some lettuce and the avocado were also brown. I was also given no butter with my bread. Needless to say i will not ever get food at this location again as this is not what i expected and a huge waste of money.

GF - welp if you are Gluten free and craving a hamburger and shake your are in the right place.  It was too busy to even attempt to eat here Saturday evening,  Monday night much less crowded.  I really don&#39;t know how anyone can give less than 3 stars cause you pretty much know what you are getting if you&#39;ve ever been to a Cheesecake Factory before.  I&#39;m picturing if I was to scroll through 500 + reviews I would see an average of 3s and 4s.  I want a 3.5 option soooo 4 it is then if it gets up to 4 I&#39;ll let someone else be the bad guy, unless it&#39;s me the next time I&#39;m here very soon.  I like to say this is where the ladies come to get wasted on marand pretend they came for desert.

The food was good. Jelani our server was great. My only complaint was that I had to point out a roach to the individual at the front desk while me and my girlfriend waited for a table. It was a little off putting, but still a good experience overall.

How disappointing!<br>Horrible service!<br>We were seated for 1/2 hour with no service whatsoever.<br>There were 5 of us waiting.<br>Until I approached the hostess, there was no recognition that we existed.  <br>Then a server came to our table and explained that the shift was changing and we shouldn&#39;t have been seated in that section.  We, the customer, just wanted service.  We did not need to know the behind the scenes issues.<br>She, then, stated that even though she was getting ready to leave that she would wait on us if we only wanted coffee and dessert!!!  <br>We ordered coffee and dessert!<br>Again, we waited for 20 minutes-no water, no coffee-nothing. Now we&#39;ve been sitting for almost an hour with no food or drink.<br>After this wait another server brought our coffee and dessert. <br>What has happened to this Cheesecake Factory???  The service is now poor and the food is no longer up to par.<br>No need for apologies.  Just needed to share our experience.

HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE!  SO BAD, WE LEFT!!   Can I rate them a zero???  We went early afternoon on Saturday, April 8 ... weather was gorgeous, so we sat outside.  It took the waitress at least 15 minutes to finally come to our table for drink orders ... It was not crowded outside ... got my drink fairly quickly, but my wife&#39;s never came.  The waitress finally, after maybe 15 more minutes, came to take our food (dinner salads only) orders - never coming back to offer a drink re-fill to me or additional bread.  When our order didn&#39;t come after 30 more minutes (about 1 hour total being there ... and, again, it was NOT crowded outside!!), we decided to leave.  I went inside and asked for a manager to tell her we were leaving and I would pay for my drink - and she was as pathetic as our waitress - only said she was sorry - never said something like &#34;please hold on, let me check to find out what&#39;s the problem&#34;.  I then walked outside with her and pointed out our table where my wife was still sitting - she then walked back inside to a computer screen, presumably to see what we had ordered and when.   My wife later told me that while I was inside talking with the manager, the waitress came to our table with a drink re-fill for me and said she&#39;d check on our meals (salads, no less) that had been ordered about 30 minutes prior, and my wife told the waitress that we were leaving and the waitress just said &#34;ok&#34;, never apologizing or saying she would get a manager.  My wife then walked up and the manager never offered us anything such as a complimentary meal in the future, a take-out of our order for free, or even a dessert to go --- and she never said anything about finding out what had gone wrong - she just said, &#34;I&#39;m sorry&#34; - right, that only goes so far. - pitiful customer service.  We&#39;ve been to this Cheesecake Factory at Perimeter Mall many, many times, and told that to the manager, but that didn&#39;t seem to phase her.  We have never walked out of a restaurant due to poor service, but everyone failed here - absolutely the waitress, presumably the kitchen and definitely the manager.  BOTTOM LINE - WE WILL NEVER GO BACK HERE, NEVER!<br><br>Totally canned BS response from customer service ... and that&#39;s why this location is so pathetic and should be avoided
GREAT PLACE! <br>I love this place, it has so much to choose from. Also everything you get taste so GOOD! You cant go wrong going to this place.

I love The Cheesecake Factory.  I just feel good when I walk in here.  I like the decor, the service, the people, and the food.  I have tried many items on the menu, which is really a book, and my absolute favorite is the Chicken Madeira.  <br><br>Were you there one day and heard someone at the next table slurping and smacking very loudly?  Yeah, that was me.  I had picked up the plate and was drinking and licking the rest of the Madeira sauce off of it.  I didn&#39;t notice you looking at me.  <br><br>Whenever I go, the service is always on point, the drinks are good and strong, and I leave a very happy woman.  <br><br>Plus, I love their Happy Hour.  M-F 1/2 priced appetizers ($5) and huge portions.  $5 drinks.  I&#39;m a regular Bae!

I met a friend here for happy hour (4-6pm, $5 apps and drinks) and cheesecake on Monday evening. <br><br>Service: Our server was professional and super nice. He was great for recommendations and kept everything refilled.  <br><br>Wait: We opted to sit in the bar for happy hour, so there was no wait at all on a Monday evening at 5:45. <br><br>Food: We ordered spinach artichoke dip (ok), avocado egg rolls (must get these! so good!), the new s&#39;mores cheesecake (yum), and the Godiva cheesecake (omg! the server suggested this one and it was delicious).  <br><br>I try to avoid chain restaurants, but the call of cheesecake was too good to pass up, and the happy hour here is pretty stellar.  We&#39;ll be back.

Terrible service. It took twenty minutes just to try and place a to-go order. My wife and I were with a friend and when he stepped up to order a family of 5 cut in front of him and the waitress/cashier  acted like she didn&#39;t see us. Meanwhile, her coworkers were cackling next to us and doing absolutely no work while the line just got longer and longer. I won&#39;t be returning.

This is one of my favorite restaurants to go to. I&#39;ve been visiting this location for years now. I&#39;m finally writing a review.<br><br>I came here a few nights ago with 20+ people for a birthday party. The bad thing about big party reservations is that the whole party has to be there or else they can&#39;t hold it for you. <br><br>I always order the spaghetti with meat sauce. They take a simple American classic dish and makes it as good as it can get. This dish never fails me. However, this time, I wanted to try other dishes they had on their menu. I ordered off of their specialties selection of their menu. I ordered the chicken bellagio. It is a &#34;Crispy Coated Chicken Breast over Basil Pasta and Parmesan Cream Sauce Topped with Prosciutto and Arugula Salad&#34; as described on their menu. It was good, however, I&#39;m not a fan of the thin fried chicken &#34;steaks&#34; or patties. The pasta was good, surprisingly, with the arugula salad (that I mixed with it). It also comes with a thinly sliced ham on top of the salad. The server described it as &#34;pork&#34;. Overall, it was pretty good. I still had a lot left over because the portions are really big. My boyfriend ordered thai chicken pasta which was very delish. It is cooked with green and &#34;normal&#34; pasta with chunks of chicken with bean sprouts. Sort of like pad thai. We also ordered the calamari as an appetizer. It is one of the best calamari I&#39;ve ever had. It comes with marinara and tartar sauce. My boyfriend ordered the coke and tequila mixed (coke &amp; jose cuervo) drink which he didn&#39;t think was mixed well. <br><br>Also, the cheesecake here is very good also. I didn&#39;t order it this time for we brought in a birthday cake. Their dessert menu is very extensive. <br><br>Overall, I had a great experience and it was well worth my money since you get large portions that you could eat for the next day.

This place is always pack, no matter what time of day you think is their down time... there truly aren&#39;t any. I&#39;m almost positive that everyone has consumed here... I won&#39;t go into details of food.<br><br>I come here for fabulous cheesecake, generous portion of food that I either share/take home for lunch the next day and mango freeze. <br><br>It&#39;s one of the few chain restaurants that I keep coming back to because of their consistency in service and in their food.

Ok so this 5  star review is just for last night and my delicious cheesecake that I had!!   So yesterday was the 30th Anniversary for Cheesecake Factory and they had $1.50 slices....yes ladies and gentleman you read that correctly only ONE dollar and FIFTY cents!!!!!    ooooooh.....ahhhhhh.........<br><br>Let me add, that granted the wait was absolutely ridiculous due to this joyous sweet tooth occasion, but man was it worth it......I had the Dulce de Leche cheescake and it was soooooooooooo yum!!!  Even met other cheesecake fans while waiting, it was a great deal, and a good dessert run!!      :)

Went to this location about a week ago. Our service was poor, I contacted this location about it and never heard from anyone. This tells me the service we received was acceptable to management. The food was good and if I had good service it may not have been my last time visiting.

What a shame. These folks have a beautiful room with nice high ceilings, and kitschy, Hollywood movie set look, a gorgeous bar and plenty of space. <br>We were met with blank stares (by the afternoon manager) and shuffled off to a noisy seat by the kitchen after asking to be moved from a boring, cramped, two-top booth looking out to the side parking lot. I explained to the manager and staff that I was taking my son out for lunch after college finals and we wanted to enjoy the space (which was not at all crowded at 3:30 pm). Over the din of tacky tourist muzak and clattering plates and glasses, I asked that we move again, this time a little closer to the bar. Again, the room is nice and airy, but the tacky muzak just beats down on your mind and provides great cover for the waitrons to momentarily acknowledge the customer, throw stuff on the table and keep moving. <br>My son said his Kobe beef burger was great. My &#34;Jambalaya&#34; pasta was so-so...spicey and plentiful, but frozen shrimp and dry chicken place keepers were inexpertly prepared and presented. <br>&#34;Close...but no cigar&#34;.<br>The contempt by the manager and staff for the suckers whom wander in to overpay for the mediocre, loud tourist experience is pretty thinly veiled--but given cover by the relentless cacophony pressing down from above. Why unlock the doors and let folks in if you don&#39;t really want them there? I mean...show more love, man. Turn the Muzak down a little. <br>What a shame. Such a nice room.
Like this place ! My favorite favorite dish -Bristro shrimp pasta!!!  just so~ good !

Most of the time I go I order the farfalle. It is a delicious pasta entree with bacon bits, chicken, sun dried tomatoes and mushrooms. Sometimes that particular entree is saltier than usual and sometimes its more on the bland side. When I inform the waiter/waitress, they take it back and fix it and it&#39;s fine after. I recommend the place and that dish.
The food is consistent for this chain and service is very consistent as well. Always super busy (as with most Cheesecake Factories) so plan to wait 45+ minutes at dinner time.
Loveeeee this place!! Great food, great environment, customer service is good could be better. GREAT MARGARITAS ;)

Had a great meal at a neighboring restaurant, but wanted a slice of cheesecake for dessert.
